author: John Keats
quote: Beauty is truth, truth beauty,--that is all Ye know on earth, and all ye need to know.

author: John Keats
quote: I am certain of nothing but the holiness of the Heart's affections and the truth of the Imagination.

author: John Keats
quote: What the imagination seizes as beauty must be truth.

author: John Keats
quote: I never can feel certain of any truth, but from a clear perception of its beauty.

author: John Keats
quote: I love you the more in that I believe you had liked me for my own sake and for nothing else.

author: John Keats
quote: Love is my religion - I could die for it.

author: John Keats
quote: You are always new, the last of your kisses was ever the sweetest.

author: John Keats
quote: I almost wish we were butterflies and liv'd but three summer days - three such days with you I could fill with more delight than fifty common years could ever contain.

author: John Keats
quote: My love is selfish. I cannot breathe without you.

author: John Keats
quote: Now a soft kiss - Aye, by that kiss, I vow an endless bliss.

author: John Keats
quote: I have so much of you in my heart.

author: John Keats
quote: I cannot exist without you - I am forgetful of every thing but seeing you again - my Life seems to stop there - I see no further. You have absorb'd me.

author: John Keats
quote: A thing of beauty is a joy forever: its loveliness increases; it will never pass into nothingness.

author: John Keats
quote: With a great poet the sense of Beauty overcomes every other consideration, or rather obliterates all consideration.

author: Emily Dickinson
quote: Truth is so rare, it is delightful to tell it.

author: Emily Dickinson
quote: Tell all the truth but tell it slant--

author: Emily Dickinson
quote: The truth I do not dare to know I muffle with a jest.

author: Emily Dickinson
quote: That love is all there is, is all we know of love.

author: Emily Dickinson
quote: Love is anterior to life, posterior to death, initial of creation, and the exponent of breath.

author: Emily Dickinson
quote: Unable are the loved to die, for love is immortality.

author: Emily Dickinson
quote: Till I loved I never lived.

author: Emily Dickinson
quote: Morning without you is a dwindled dawn.

author: Emily Dickinson
quote: I argue thee that love is life. And life hath immortality.

author: Emily Dickinson
quote: To love is so startling, it leaves little time for anything else.

author: Emily Dickinson
quote: Heart, we will forget him, You and I, tonight! You must forget the warmth he gave, I will forget the light.

author: Emily Dickinson
quote: We outgrow love like other things and put it in a drawer, till it an antique fashion shows like costumes grandsires wore.

author: Emily Dickinson
quote: Behold this little Bane--The Boon of all alive--As common as it is unknown The name of it is Love.

author: Emily Dickinson
quote: Beauty is not caused. It is.

author: Emily Dickinson
quote: Beauty crowds me till I die, Beauty, mercy have on me! Yet if I expire to-day Let it be in sight of thee!

author: Emily Dickinson
quote: A charm invests a face imperfectly beheld.

author: Emily Dickinson
quote: I died for Beauty--but was scarce Adjusted in the Tomb When One who died for Truth, was lain In an adjoining Room.

author: Walt Whitman
quote: Only aware to-day of compact, all-diffused truth; / Discovering to-day there is no lie, or form of lie, and can be none, but grows as inevitably upon itself as the truth does upon itself.

author: Walt Whitman
quote: And that the truth includes all, and is compact, just as much as space is compact, / And that there is no flaw or vacuum in the amount of the truth--but that all is truth without exception.

author: Walt Whitman
quote: Whatever satisfies the soul is truth.

author: Walt Whitman
quote: It is a beautiful truth that all men contain something of the artist in them.

author: Walt Whitman
quote: I have loved many women and men, but I love none better than you.

author: Walt Whitman
quote: Love, that is day and night--love, that is sun and moon and stars, Love, that is crimson, sumptuous, sick with perfume, no other words but words of love, no other thought but love.

author: Walt Whitman
quote: Sometimes with one I love, I fill myself with rage, for fear I effuse unreturn'd love; But now I think there is no unreturn'd love--the pay is certain, one way or another.

author: Walt Whitman
quote: I give you my hand, I give you my love more precious than money, I give you myself before preaching or law; Will you give me yourself?

author: Walt Whitman
quote: Be not dishearten'd--Affection shall solve the problems of Freedom yet; Those who love each other shall become invincible.

author: Walt Whitman
quote: All beauty comes from beautiful blood and a beautiful brain.

author: Walt Whitman
quote: The soul is always beautiful, it appears more or it appears less, it comes or it lags behind, It comes from its embowered garden and looks pleasantly on itself and encloses the world.

author: Walt Whitman
quote: What beauty there is in words; what a lurking curious charm in the sound some words.

author: Walt Whitman
quote: Most works are most beautiful without ornament.

author: Walt Whitman
quote: Peace is always beautiful.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Nothing is at last sacred but the integrity of your own mind.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The soul is the perceiver and revealer of truth. We know truth when we see it, let skeptic and scoffer say what they choose.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Every violation of truth is not only a sort of suicide in the liar, but is a stab at the health of human society.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Truth is the property of no individual but is the treasure of all men.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Every mind must make its choice between truth and repose. It cannot have both.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The greatest homage to truth is to use it.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Truth is beautiful, without doubt; but so are lies.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: No man thoroughly understands a truth until he has contended against it.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Love, and you shall be loved.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: All mankind love a lover.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Give all to love; Obey thy heart.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The reason why all men honor love is because it looks up, and not down; aspires and not despairs.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Thou art to me a delicious torment.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: He who is in love is wise and is becoming wiser, sees newly every time he looks at the object beloved, drawing from it with his eyes and his mind those virtues which it possesses.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The love that you withhold is the pain that you carry.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Marriage is the perfection which love aimed at, ignorant of what it sought.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Beauty without grace is the hook without the bait.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: We ascribe beauty to that which is simple; which has no superfluous parts; which exactly answers its end; which stands related to all things; which is the mean of many extremes.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Things are pretty, graceful, rich, elegant, handsome, but, until they speak to the imagination, not yet beautiful.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Never lose an opportunity of seeing anything beautiful, for beauty is God's handwriting.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Though we travel the world over to find the beautiful, we must carry it with us or we find it not.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Love of beauty is taste. The creation of beauty is art.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: To the attentive eye, each moment of the year has its own beauty, and in the same fields, it beholds, every hour, a picture which was never seen before, and which shall never be seen again.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Beauty is the mark God sets on virtue. Every natural action is graceful; every heroic act is also decent, and causes the place and the bystanders to shine.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: If eyes were made for seeing, then beauty is its own excuse for being.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Flowers... are a proud assertion that a ray of beauty outvalues all the utilities of the world.

author: Plotinus
quote: Truth is the agreement of the mind with itself.

author: Plotinus
quote: Knowledge has three degrees 6opinion, science, illumination. The means or instrument of the first is sense; of the second, dialectic; of the third, intuition. To the last I subordinate reason. It is absolute knowledge founded on the identity of the mind knowing with the object known.

author: Plotinus
quote: Truth is self-accordance; it affirms and is nothing other than itself and is nothing other.

author: Plotinus
quote: We must close our eyes and invoke a new manner of seeing... a wakefulness that is the birthright of us all, though few put it to use.

author: Plotinus
quote: The highest truth can only be realized through intense contemplation and inner stillness.

author: Plotinus
quote: What is Love? A God, a Celestial Spirit, a state of mind? Or is it, perhaps, sometimes to be thought of as a God or Spirit and sometimes merely as an experience?

author: Plotinus
quote: It is sound, I think, to find the primal source of Love in a tendency of the Soul towards pure beauty, in a recognition, in a kinship, in an unreasoned consciousness of friendly relation.

author: Plotinus
quote: Pure Love seeks the beauty alone, whether there is Reminiscence or not; but there are those that feel, also, a desire of such immortality as lies within mortal reach; and these are seeking Beauty in their demand for perpetuity, the desire of the eternal.

author: Plotinus
quote: Love, thus, is ever intent upon that other loveliness, and exists to be the medium between desire and that object of desire.

author: Plotinus
quote: Love, therefore, is like a goad; it is without resource in itself; even winning its end, it is poor again.

author: Plotinus
quote: Being is desirable because it is identical with Beauty, and Beauty is loved because it is Being. We ourselves possess Beauty when we are true to our own being; ugliness is in going over to another order; knowing ourselves, we are beautiful; in self-ignorance, we are ugly.

author: Plotinus
quote: Withdraw into yourself and look. And if you do not find yourself beautiful yet, act as does the creator of a statue that is to be made beautiful: he cuts away here, he smoothes there, he makes this line lighter, this other purer, until a lovely face has grown upon his work. So do you also: cut away all that is excessive, straighten all that is crooked, bring light to all that is overcast, labor to make all one glow of beauty and never cease chiseling your statue, until there shall shine out on you from it the godlike splendor of virtue, until you shall see the perfect goodness surely established in the stainless shrine.

author: Plotinus
quote: The sensitive eye can never be able to survey the orb of the sun, unless strongly endued with solar fire, and participating largely of the vivid ray. Everyone therefore must become divine, and of godlike beauty, before he can gaze upon a god and the beautiful itself.

author: Plotinus
quote: We must ascend, therefore, once more to the Good, which every soul desires. If anyone has beheld It, he will know what I say, and in what manner It is beautiful, for it is as good that It is desired, and all appetency is towards goodness.

author: Plotinus
quote: The soul, borne upwards towards intellect, puts on a marvellous beauty. Intellect, and that which comes from Intellect, is the beauty which truly belongs to her and is not foreign to her; because, when united to It, and then only, is she truly soul.

author: Plato
quote: False words are not only evil in themselves, but they infect the soul with evil.

author: Plato
quote: You should not honor men more than truth.

author: Plato
quote: Truth is the beginning of every good to the gods, and of every good to man.

author: Plato
quote: There is nothing so delightful as the hearing, or the speaking of truth. For this reason, there is no conversation so agreeable as that of the man of integrity, who hears without any intention to betray, and speaks without any intention to deceive.

author: Plato
quote: No one is more hated than he who speaks the truth.

author: Plato
quote: The qualities of number appear to lead to the apprehension of truth.

author: Plato
quote: Honesty is for the most part less profitable than dishonesty.

author: Plato
quote: They deem him their worst enemy who tells them the truth.

author: Plato
quote: Truth is the beginning of every good thing, both in heaven and on earth; and he who would be blessed and happy should be from the first a partaker of truth, for then he can be trusted.

author: Plato
quote: Seven years of silent inquiry are needful for a man to learn the truth, but fourteen in order to learn how to make it known to his fellow-men.

author: Plato
quote: All I would ask you to be thinking of is the truth and not Socrates.

author: Plato
quote: What essence is to generation, that truth is to belief.

author: Plato
quote: To speak knowing the truth, among prudent and dear men, about what is greatest and dear, is a thing that is safe and encouraging. But to present arguments at a time when one is in doubt and seeking... is a thing both frightening and slippery.

author: Plato
quote: Renouncing the honors at which the world aims, I desire only to know the truth... and to the maximum of my power, I exhort all other men to do the same.

author: Plato
quote: Truth is the source of every good thing in heaven and on earth. He who expects to be blessed and fortunate in this world should be a partaker of truth.

author: Plato
quote: And isn't it a bad thing to be deceived about the truth, and a good thing to know what the truth is? For I assume that by knowing the truth you mean knowing things as they really are.

author: Plato
quote: The philosopher is in love with truth, that is, not with the changing world of sensation, which is the object of opinion, but with the unchanging reality which is the object of knowledge.

author: Plato
quote: Truthfulness. He will never willingly tolerate an untruth, but will hate it as much as he loves truth... And is there anything more closely connected with wisdom than truth?

author: Plato
quote: What is at issue is the conversion of the mind from the twilight of error to the truth, that climb up into the real world which we shall call true philosophy.

author: Plato
quote: The object of knowledge is what exists and its function to know about reality.

author: Plato
quote: One trait in the philosopher's character we can assume is his love of the knowledge that reveals eternal reality, the realm unaffected by change and decay. He is in love with the whole of that reality, and will not willingly be deprived even of the most insignificant fragment of it - just like the lovers and men of ambition we described earlier on.

author: Plato
quote: Then may we not fairly plead in reply that our true lover of knowledge naturally strives for truth, and is not content with common opinion, but soars with undimmed and unwearied passion till he grasps the essential nature of things with the mental faculty fitted to do so, that is, with the faculty which is akin to reality, and which approaches and unites with it, and begets intelligence and truth as children, and is only released from travail when it has thus reached knowledge and true life and satisfaction?

author: Plato
quote: And those whose hearts are fixed on Reality itself deserve the title of Philosophers.

author: Plato
quote: When the mind's eye rests on objects illuminated by truth and reality, it understands and comprehends them, and functions intelligently; but when it turns to the twilight world of change and decay, it can only form opinions, its vision is confused and its beliefs shifting, and it seems to lack intelligence.

author: Plato
quote: Love is simply the name for the desire and pursuit of the whole.

author: Plato
quote: At the touch of love, everyone becomes a poet.

author: Plato
quote: Love is born into every human being; it calls back the halves of our original nature together; it tries to make one out of two and heal the wound of human nature.

author: Plato
quote: He whom love touches not walks in darkness.

author: Plato
quote: Love is the joy of the good, the wonder of the wise, the amazement of the Gods.

author: Plato
quote: Beauty of style and harmony and grace and good rhythm depend on simplicity.

author: Plato
quote: When a beautiful soul harmonizes with a beautiful form, and the two are cast in one mould, that will be the fairest of sights to him who has the eye to contemplate the vision.

author: Plato
quote: The power of the Good has taken refuge in the nature of the Beautiful.

author: Plato
quote: The contemplation of beauty causes the soul to grow wings.

author: Plato
quote: It seems to me that whatever else is beautiful apart from absolute beauty is beautiful because it partakes of that absolute beauty, and for no other reason.

author: Plato
quote: The good is the beautiful.

author: Plato
quote: For he who would proceed aright... should begin in youth to visit beautiful forms... out of that he should create fair thoughts; and soon he will of himself perceive that the beauty of one form is akin to the beauty of another, and that beauty in every form is one and the same.

author: Confucius
quote: The object of the superior man is truth.

author: Confucius
quote: Those who know the truth are not equal to those who love it.

author: Confucius
quote: Three things cannot long be hidden: the sun, the moon, and the truth.

author: Confucius
quote: Sincerity and truth are the basis of every virtue.

author: Confucius
quote: It is man that makes truth great, and not truth that makes man great.

author: Confucius
quote: To love a thing means wanting it to live.

author: Confucius
quote: Can there be a love which does not make demands on its object?

author: Confucius
quote: Love others as you would love yourself, judge others as you would judge yourself, cherish others as you would cherish yourself. When you wish for others as you wish for yourself and when you protect others as you would protect yourself, that's when you can say it's true love.

author: Confucius
quote: When we are in love, we do not see the faults of our beloved.

author: Confucius
quote: Love is the foundation of all virtues.

author: Confucius
quote: Everything has beauty, but not everyone sees it.

author: Confucius
quote: Fine words and an insinuating appearance are seldom associated with true virtue.

author: Confucius
quote: I have yet to meet a man as fond of high moral conduct as he is of outward appearances.

author: Lao Tzu
quote: The truth is not always beautiful, nor beautiful words the truth.

author: Lao Tzu
quote: The words of truth are always paradoxical.

author: Lao Tzu
quote: Truthful words are not beautiful; beautiful words are not truthful. Good words are not persuasive; persuasive words are not good.

author: Lao Tzu
quote: He who knows does not speak; he who speaks does not know.

author: Lao Tzu
quote: Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage.

author: Lao Tzu
quote: Love is of all passions the strongest, for it attacks simultaneously the head, the heart, and the senses.

author: Lao Tzu
quote: Kindness in words creates confidence. Kindness in thinking creates profoundness. Kindness in giving creates love.

author: Lao Tzu
quote: Because of a great love, one is courageous.

author: Lao Tzu
quote: Simplicity, patience, compassion. These three are your greatest treasures.

author: Lao Tzu
quote: When people see some things as beautiful, other things become ugly. When people see some things as good, other things become bad.

author: Lao Tzu
quote: Under heaven all can see beauty as beauty only because there is ugliness. All can know good as good only because there is evil.

author: Lao Tzu
quote: When the people of the world all know beauty as beauty, there arises the recognition of ugliness. When they all know the good as good, there arises the recognition of evil.

author: Lao Tzu
quote: When beauty is defined, illusions of non-beauty manifest. When goodness is identified, badness becomes an option.

author: Lao Tzu
quote: All in the world know the beauty of the beautiful, and in doing this they have (the idea of) what ugliness is.

author: Vyasa
quote: One who speaks truth is righteous. There is nothing higher than truth.

author: Vyasa
quote: Truth is one undeteriorating Brahma. Truth is the one undeteriorating Penance. Truth is the one undeteriorating sacrifice. Truth is the one undeteriorating Veda.

author: Vyasa
quote: Truth alone triumphs, not falsehood.

author: Vyasa
quote: A truth-telling person attains a life devoid of trouble.

author: Vyasa
quote: The desire to possess, the thirst for and the hankering after pleasure or the means thereof, preceded by a remembrance of the pleasure in one who has enjoyed it, is attachment.

author: Vyasa
quote: In all living beings exists the self-benediction, 'would that I were never to cease. May I live on.' And this self-benediction cannot exist in him who has not experienced the nature of death. And by this experience of a former life is inferred. This is the affliction of Love of Life, which flows by its own potency.

author: Vyasa
quote: Pleasure from the senses seems like nectar at first, but it is bitter as poison in the end.

author: Vyasa
quote: He who has let go of hatred, who treats all beings with kindness and compassion, who is always serene, unmoved by pain or pleasure, free of the 'I' and 'mine,' self-controlled, firm and patient, his whole mind focused on me--that is the man I love best.

author: Vyasa
quote: When a person responds to the joys and sorrows of others as if they were his own, he has attained the highest state of spiritual union.

author: Vyasa
quote: O thou of beautiful face... Endued with unrivalled beauty and celestial grace of the most attractive kind, that face of thine is even like the full moon...

author: Vyasa
quote: The wise knowing the instability of youth and beauty, of life and treasure-hoards, of prosperity and the company of the loved ones, never covet them.

author: Vyasa
quote: To us all life is sacred and that sacred life is like Kali. Violent and gentle at once, savage slayer and tender lover, life and death... everything is beautiful. Immensely, indescribably, thrillingly, rapturously beautiful.

author: Vyasa
quote: Flowers, when offered to the deities gratify them immediately... they cause all the objects cherished by their worshippers to be immediately accomplished.

author: Buddha
quote: Three things cannot be long hidden: the sun, the moon, and the truth.

author: Buddha
quote: Believe nothing, no matter where you read it, or who said it, no matter if I have said it, unless it agrees with your own reason and your own common sense.

author: Buddha
quote: Do not believe in anything simply because you have heard it. Do not believe in anything simply because it is spoken and rumored by many. Do not believe in anything simply because it is found written in your religious books. Do not believe in anything merely on the authority of your teachers and elders.

author: Buddha
quote: Conquer anger by love, evil by good; conquer the miser with liberality, and the liar with truth.

author: Buddha
quote: The gift of truth excels all other gifts.

author: Buddha
quote: Hatred does not cease by hatred, but only by love; this is the eternal rule.

author: Buddha
quote: Radiate boundless love towards the entire world -- above, below, and across -- unhindered, without ill will, without enmity.

author: Buddha
quote: Just as a mother would protect her only child with her life, even so let one cultivate a boundless love towards all beings.

author: Buddha
quote: You, yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe, deserve your love and affection.

author: Buddha
quote: If you truly loved yourself, you could never hurt another.

author: Buddha
quote: Love is a gift of one's innermost soul to another so both can be whole.

author: Buddha
quote: In separateness lies the world's great misery; in compassion lies the world's true strength.

author: Buddha
quote: Let a man overcome anger by love.

author: Buddha
quote: If we could see the miracle of a single flower clearly, our whole life would change.

author: Buddha
quote: Like a fine flower, beautiful to look at but without scent, fine words are fruitless in a man who does not act in accordance with them.

author: Buddha
quote: Love is beauty and beauty is truth, and that is why in the beauty of a flower we can see the truth of the universe.

author: Buddha
quote: Fashion your life as a garland of beautiful deeds.

author: Buddha
quote: The only lasting beauty is the beauty of the heart.

author: King Solomon
quote: Do not let kindness and truth leave you; Bind them around your neck, Write them on the tablet of your heart.

author: King Solomon
quote: A righteous man hates lying, But a wicked man is loathsome and comes to shame.

author: King Solomon
quote: The tongue has the power of life and death.

author: King Solomon
quote: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom.

author: King Solomon
quote: The man who walks with wise men becomes wise himself.

author: King Solomon
quote: Let him kiss me with the kisses of his mouth: for thy love is better than wine.

author: King Solomon
quote: Many waters cannot quench love; rivers cannot sweep it away.

author: King Solomon
quote: Place me like a seal over your heart, like a seal on your arm; for love is as strong as death.

author: King Solomon
quote: A friend loves at all times, and a brother is born for a time of adversity.

author: King Solomon
quote: Above all else, guard your heart, for everything you do flows from it.

author: King Solomon
quote: Do not arouse or awaken love until it so desires.

author: King Solomon
quote: A wife of noble character who can find? She is worth far more than rubies.

author: King Solomon
quote: You are altogether beautiful, my darling; there is no flaw in you.

author: King Solomon
quote: How beautiful you are, my darling! Oh, how beautiful! Your eyes behind your veil are doves.

author: King Solomon
quote: How beautiful your sandaled feet, O prince's daughter! Your graceful legs are like jewels, the work of an artist's hands. Your navel is a rounded goblet that never lacks blended wine.

author: King Solomon
quote: Charm is deceptive, and beauty is fleeting; but a woman who fears the Lord is to be praised.

author: King Solomon
quote: She is more precious than rubies; nothing you desire can compare with her. Long life is in her right hand; in her left hand are riches and honor. Her ways are pleasant ways, and all her paths are peace. She is a tree of life to those who take hold of her; those who hold her fast will be blessed.

author: Rumi
quote: That which is false troubles the heart, but truth brings joyous tranquility.

author: Rumi
quote: This is a subtle truth. Whatever you love, you are.

author: Rumi
quote: You are the Truth from foot to brow. Now, what else would you like to know?

author: Rumi
quote: A seeker of Truth looks beyond the apparent and contemplates the hidden.

author: Rumi
quote: The seeker of truth is a mirror for their neighbors.

author: Rumi
quote: A pure heart, open to the Light, will be filled with the elixir of Truth.

author: Rumi
quote: Love is the bridge between you and everything.

author: Rumi
quote: Your task is not to seek for love, but merely to seek and find all the barriers within yourself that you have built against it.

author: Rumi
quote: The minute I heard my first love story, I started looking for you, not knowing how blind that was. Lovers don't finally meet somewhere. They're in each other all along.

author: Rumi
quote: Let yourself be silently drawn by the stronger pull of that which you truly love.

author: Rumi
quote: Close your eyes, fall in love, stay there.

author: Rumi
quote: Reason is powerless in the expression of Love.

author: Rumi
quote: In your light I learn how to love. In your beauty, how to make poems. You dance inside my chest where no one sees you, but sometimes I do, and that sight becomes this art.

author: Rumi
quote: Love rests on no foundation. It is an endless ocean, with no beginning or end.

author: Rumi
quote: Goodbyes are only for those who love with their eyes. Because for those who love with heart and soul there is no such thing as separation.

author: Rumi
quote: Be certain that in the religion of Love there are no believers and unbelievers. Love embraces all.

author: Rumi
quote: Let the beauty of what you love be what you do.

author: Rumi
quote: Everything in the universe is a pitcher brimming with wisdom and beauty.

author: Rumi
quote: The only lasting beauty is the beauty of the heart.

author: Rumi
quote: Beauty surrounds us, but usually we need to be walking in a garden to know it.

author: Rumi
quote: By God, when you see your beauty you will be the idol of yourself.

author: Rumi
quote: Whenever Beauty looks, Love is also there; Whenever beauty shows a rosy cheek Love lights Her fire from that flame.

author: Rabindranath Tagore
quote: Facts are many, but the truth is one.

author: Rabindranath Tagore
quote: The water in a vessel is sparkling; the water in the sea is dark. The small truth has words which are clear; the great truth has great silence.

author: Rabindranath Tagore
quote: If you shut your door to all errors, truth will be shut out.

author: Rabindranath Tagore
quote: The false can never grow into truth by growing in power.

author: Rabindranath Tagore
quote: Bigotry tries to keep truth safe in its hand with a grip that kills it.

author: Rabindranath Tagore
quote: Truth reveals itself in beauty.

author: Rabindranath Tagore
quote: The truth comes as conqueror only because we have lost the art of receiving it as guest.

author: Rabindranath Tagore
quote: Love does not claim possession, but gives freedom.

author: Rabindranath Tagore
quote: I seem to have loved you in numberless forms, numberless times, in life after life, in age after age forever.

author: Rabindranath Tagore
quote: Love is an endless mystery, because there is no reasonable cause that could explain it.

author: Rabindranath Tagore
quote: Love's gift cannot be given, it waits to be accepted.

author: Rabindranath Tagore
quote: Love is the only reality and it is not a mere sentiment. It is the ultimate truth that lies at the heart of creation.

author: Rabindranath Tagore
quote: You smiled and talked to me of nothing and I felt that for this I had been waiting long.

author: Rabindranath Tagore
quote: Let your love be like a moving sea between the shores of your souls.

author: Rabindranath Tagore
quote: He who wants to do good, knocks at the gate; he who loves finds the door open.

author: Rabindranath Tagore
quote: My heart, the bird of the wilderness, has found its sky in your eyes.

author: Rabindranath Tagore
quote: Let this be my last word, that I trust in thy love.

author: Rabindranath Tagore
quote: Beauty is truth's smile when she beholds her own face in a perfect mirror.

author: Rabindranath Tagore
quote: By plucking her petals, you do not gather the beauty of the flower.

author: Rabindranath Tagore
quote: O Beauty, find thyself in love, not in the flattery of thy mirror.

author: Rabindranath Tagore
quote: Beauty is simply reality seen with the eyes of love.

author: Rabindranath Tagore
quote: When he has the power to see things detached from self-interest and from the insistent claims of the lust of the senses, then alone can he have the true vision of the beauty that is everywhere.

author: Kahlil Gibran
quote: Say not, 'I have found the truth,' but rather, 'I have found a truth.'

author: Kahlil Gibran
quote: A truth is to be known always, to be uttered sometimes.

author: Kahlil Gibran
quote: Truth is a deep kindness that teaches us to be content in our everyday life and share with the people the same happiness.

author: Kahlil Gibran
quote: Many a doctrine is like a window pane. We see truth through it but it divides us from truth.

author: Kahlil Gibran
quote: If you can see only what light reveals and hear only what sound announces, then in truth you do not see nor do you hear.

author: Kahlil Gibran
quote: True light is that which radiates from within a man. It reveals the secrets of the soul to the soul and lets it rejoice in life, singing in the name of the Spirit.

author: Kahlil Gibran
quote: Love one another, but make not a bond of love: let it rather be a moving sea between the shores of your souls.

author: Kahlil Gibran
quote: Love possesses not nor would it be possessed; for love is sufficient unto love.

author: Kahlil Gibran
quote: Ever has it been that love knows not its own depth until the hour of separation.

author: Kahlil Gibran
quote: If you love somebody, let them go, for if they return, they were always yours. If they don't, they never were.

author: Kahlil Gibran
quote: When love beckons to you, follow him, though his ways are hard and steep.

author: Kahlil Gibran
quote: Beauty is eternity gazing at itself in a mirror. But you are eternity and you are the mirror.

author: Kahlil Gibran
quote: Beauty is life when life unveils her holy face. But you are life and you are the veil.

author: Kahlil Gibran
quote: Beauty is not in the face; beauty is a light in the heart.

author: Kahlil Gibran
quote: Beauty is that which attracts your soul, and that which loves to give and not to receive.

author: Kahlil Gibran
quote: Beauty shines brighter in the heart of him who longs for it than in the eyes of him who sees it.

author: Percy Shelley
quote: In fact, the truth cannot be communicated until it is perceived.

author: Percy Shelley
quote: Deep truth is imageless.

author: Percy Shelley
quote: Life may change, but it may fly not; Hope may vanish, but can die not; Truth be veiled, but still it burneth; Love repulsed, - but it returneth!

author: Percy Shelley
quote: Truth has always been found to promote the best interests of mankind.

author: Percy Shelley
quote: The practice of utter sincerity towards other men would avail to no good end, if they were incapable of practising it towards their own minds.

author: Percy Shelley
quote: Soul meets soul on lovers' lips.

author: Percy Shelley
quote: All love is sweet, given or returned. Common as light is love, and its familiar voice wearies not ever.

author: Percy Shelley
quote: Love is free; to promise for ever to love the same woman is not less absurd than to promise to believe the same creed; such a vow in both cases excludes us from all inquiry.

author: Percy Shelley
quote: Music, when soft voices die, Vibrates in the memory; Odours, when sweet violets sicken, Live within the sense they quicken. Rose leaves, when the rose is dead, Are heap'd for the belovèd's bed; And so thy thoughts, when thou art gone, Love itself shall slumber on.

author: Percy Shelley
quote: The fountains mingle with the river, And the rivers with the ocean; The winds of heaven mix forever, With a sweet emotion; Nothing in the world is single; All things, by a law divine, In one spirit meet and mingle. Why not I with thine?

author: Percy Shelley
quote: What is Love? It is that powerful attraction towards all that we conceive, or fear, or hope beyond ourselves.

author: Percy Shelley
quote: I love Love -- though he has wings, And like light can flee, But above all other things, Spirit, I love thee -- Thou art love and life! Oh come, Make once more my heart thy home.

author: Percy Shelley
quote: Poetry lifts the veil from the hidden beauty of the world, and makes familiar objects be as if they were not familiar.

author: Percy Shelley
quote: A lovely lady, garmented in light From her own beauty.

author: Percy Shelley
quote: Obscenity, which is ever blasphemy against the divine beauty in life, is a monster for which the corruption of society forever brings forth new food, which it devours in secret.

author: Percy Shelley
quote: Spirit of BEAUTY, that dost consecrate With thine own hues all thou dost shine upon Of human thought or form, where art thou gone?

author: Percy Shelley
quote: The beauty of the internal nature cannot be so far concealed by its accidental vesture, but that the spirit of its form shall communicate itself to the very disguise and indicate the shape it hides from the manner in which it is worn.

author: Vincent van Gogh
quote: My great longing is to learn to make those very incorrectnesses, those deviations, remodellings, changes of reality, so that they may become, yes, untruth if you like--but more true than the literal truth.

author: Vincent van Gogh
quote: I have played hell somewhat with the truthfulness of the colours.

author: Vincent van Gogh
quote: To tell you the truth, I couldn't spare either the old- or the new-fashioned manner. Too many beautiful things have been done too unusually well for me to prefer one to the other systematically.

author: Vincent van Gogh
quote: Love many things, for therein lies the true strength, and whosoever loves much performs much, and can accomplish much, and what is done in love is done well.

author: Vincent van Gogh
quote: There is nothing more truly artistic than to love people.

author: Vincent van Gogh
quote: Love always brings difficulties, that is true, but the good side of it is that it gives energy.

author: Vincent van Gogh
quote: Love is eternal, the aspect may change, but not the essence.

author: Vincent van Gogh
quote: I will not live without love.

author: Vincent van Gogh
quote: I long so much to make beautiful things. But beautiful things require effort and disappointment and perseverance.

author: Vincent van Gogh
quote: If you truly love nature, you will find beauty everywhere.

author: Vincent van Gogh
quote: Find things beautiful as much as you can, most people find too little beautiful.

author: Vincent van Gogh
quote: It is good to love many things, for therein lies the true strength, and whosoever loves much performs much, and can accomplish much, and what is done in love is well done.

author: Vincent van Gogh
quote: I often think that the night is more alive and more richly colored than the day.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote: Even if you are a minority of one, the truth is the truth.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote: An error does not become truth by reason of multiplied propagation, nor does truth become error because nobody sees it.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote: Truth never damages a cause that is just.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote: Truth is by nature self-evident. As soon as you remove the cobwebs of ignorance that surround it, it shines clear.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote: In matters of conscience, the law of the majority has no place.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote: My religion is based on truth and non-violence. Truth is my God. Non-violence is the means of realizing Him.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote: Truth alone will endure, all the rest will be swept away before the tide of time.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote: The path of truth is as narrow as it is straight. Even so is that of ahimsa.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote: Truth and nonviolence are perhaps the activist forces you have in the world.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote: Truth is God, and truth overrides all our plans.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote: Where there is love there is life.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote: Love is the strongest force the world possesses and yet it is the humblest imaginable.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote: Whenever you are confronted with an opponent. Conquer him with love.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote: Love never claims, it ever gives. Love ever suffers, never resents, never revenges itself.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote: Nothing is impossible for pure love.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote: Power is of two kinds: one is obtained by the fear of punishment and the other by acts of love.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote: Hatred can be overcome only by love.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote: The law of love could be best understood and learned through little children.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote: When I admire the wonders of a sunset or the beauty of the moon, my soul expands in the worship of the creator.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote: True beauty consists of purity of heart.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote: To a true artist only that face is beautiful which, quite apart from its exterior, shines with the truth within the soul.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote: Truth is the first thing to be sought for, and Beauty and Goodness will then be added unto you.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote: All truths, not merely ideas, but truthful faces, truthful pictures or songs, are highly beautiful.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote: There is no beauty in the finest cloth if it makes hunger and unhappiness.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: The truth is rarely pure and never simple.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: If you want to tell people the truth, make them laugh, otherwise they'll kill you.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: Man is least himself when he talks in his own person. Give him a mask, and he will tell you the truth.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: If one tells the truth, one is sure, sooner or later, to be found out.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: Truth is independent of facts always.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: Keep love in your heart. A life without it is like a sunless garden when the flowers are dead.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: To love oneself is the beginning of a lifelong romance.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: The very essence of romance is uncertainty.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: Who, being loved, is poor?

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: Women are meant to be loved, not to be understood.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: Men always want to be a woman's first love. That is their clumsy vanity. We women have a more subtle instinct about things.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: When one is in love, one always begins by deceiving one's self, and one always ends by deceiving others. That is what the world calls a romance.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: The mystery of love is greater than the mystery of death.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: The heart was made to be broken.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: Between men and women there is no friendship possible. There is passion, enmity, worship, love, but no friendship.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: Beauty is a form of Genius--is higher, indeed, than Genius, as it needs no explanation.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: People say sometimes that Beauty is superficial. That may be so. But at least it is not so superficial as Thought is.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: Beauty is the only thing that time cannot harm.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: Those who find ugly meanings in beautiful things are corrupt without being charming. This is a fault.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: Beauty reveals everything, because it expresses nothing.

author: Charlotte Brontë
quote: Whether truth--be it religious or moral truth--speak eloquently and in well-chosen language or not, its voice should be heard with reverence.

author: Charlotte Brontë
quote: To speak truth, reader, there is no excellent beauty, no accomplished grace, no refinement, without strength as excellent, as complete, as trustworthy.

author: Charlotte Brontë
quote: And yet there were fragments of truth here and there which satisfied the conscience, and gleams of light that cheered the vision.

author: Charlotte Brontë
quote: Conventionality is not morality. Self-righteousness is not religion. To attack the first is not to assail the last... appearance should not be mistaken for truth.

author: Charlotte Brontë
quote: The soul, fortunately, has an interpreter--often an unconscious, but still a truthful interpreter--in the eye.

author: Charlotte Brontë
quote: I have for the first time found what I can truly love--I have found you. You are my sympathy--my better self--my good angel--I am bound to you with a strong attachment.

author: Charlotte Brontë
quote: Every atom of your flesh is as dear to me as my own: in pain and sickness it would still be dear.

author: Charlotte Brontë
quote: I ask you to pass through life at my side--to be my second self, and best earthly companion.

author: Charlotte Brontë
quote: Love is real--the most real, the most lasting, the sweetest and yet the bitterest thing we know.

author: Charlotte Brontë
quote: There is no happiness like that of being loved by your fellow creatures, and feeling that your presence is an addition to their comfort.

author: Charlotte Brontë
quote: A beauty neither of fine colour nor long eyelash, nor pencilled brow, but of meaning, of movement, of radiance.

author: Charlotte Brontë
quote: Most true is it that 'beauty is in the eye of the gazer.' My master's colourless, olive face, square, massive brow, broad and jetty eyebrows, deep eyes, strong features, firm, grim mouth,--all energy, decision, will,--were not beautiful, according to rule; but they were more than beautiful to me; they were full of an interest, an influence that quite mastered me.

author: Charlotte Brontë
quote: To women who please me only by their faces, I am the very devil when I find out they have neither souls nor hearts.

author: Jane Austen
quote: Seldom, very seldom, does complete truth belong to any human disclosure; seldom can it happen that something is not a little disguised, or a little mistaken.

author: Jane Austen
quote: Do not consider me now as an elegant female intending to plague you, but as a rational creature speaking the truth from her heart.

author: Jane Austen
quote: Facts or opinions which are to pass through the hands of so many, to be misconceived by folly in one, and ignorance in another, can hardly have much truth left.

author: Jane Austen
quote: There is no charm equal to tenderness of heart.

author: Jane Austen
quote: In vain have I struggled. It will not do. My feelings will not be repressed. You must allow me to tell you how ardently I admire and love you.

author: Jane Austen
quote: A lady's imagination is very rapid; it jumps from admiration to love, from love to matrimony in a moment.

author: Jane Austen
quote: To be fond of dancing was a certain step towards falling in love.

author: Jane Austen
quote: If I loved you less, I might be able to talk about it more.

author: Jane Austen
quote: You pierce my soul. I am half agony, half hope... I have loved none but you.

author: Jane Austen
quote: We are all fools in love.

author: Jane Austen
quote: I cannot fix on the hour, or the spot, or the look, or the words, which laid the foundation. It is too long ago. I was in the middle before I knew that I had begun.

author: Jane Austen
quote: There could have been no two hearts so open, no tastes so similar, no feelings so in unison.

author: Jane Austen
quote: It is not time or opportunity that is to determine intimacy; it is disposition alone. Seven years would be insufficient to make some people acquainted with each other, and seven days are more than enough for others.

author: Jane Austen
quote: I have been meditating on the very great pleasure which a pair of fine eyes in the face of a pretty woman can bestow.

author: Jane Austen
quote: To look almost pretty is an acquisition of higher delight to a girl who has been looking plain for the first fifteen years of her life than a beauty from her cradle can ever receive.

author: Jane Austen
quote: When a woman has five grown-up daughters, she ought to give over thinking of her own beauty.

author: Jane Austen
quote: Woman is fine for her own satisfaction alone. No man will admire her the more, no woman will like her the better for it.

author: Jane Austen
quote: It sometimes happens that a woman is handsomer at twenty-nine than she was ten years before.

author: Christina Rossetti
quote: She gave up beauty in her tender youth, gave all her hope and joy and pleasant ways; she covered up her eyes lest they should gaze on vanity, and chose the bitter truth.

author: Christina Rossetti
quote: I might show facts as plain as day: but, since your eyes are blind, you'd say, 'Where? What?' and turn away.

author: Christina Rossetti
quote: I believe because I am told to believe ... My faith is faith; it is not evolved out of argumentation, nor does it seek the aid of that.

author: Christina Rossetti
quote: Love shall be our token; love be yours and love be mine.

author: Christina Rossetti
quote: What is the beginning? Love. What is the course. Love still. What the goal. The goal is love.

author: Christina Rossetti
quote: For one man is my world of all the men this wide world holds; O love, my world is you.

author: Christina Rossetti
quote: Love came down at Christmas, Love all lovely, Love Divine; Love was born at Christmas; Star and angels gave the sign.

author: Christina Rossetti
quote: Love loves for ever, And finds a sort of joy in pain, And gives with nought to take again, And loves too well to end in vain.

author: Christina Rossetti
quote: While roses are so red, / While lilies are so white, / Shall a woman exalt her face / Because it gives delight?

author: Christina Rossetti
quote: Time will win the race he runs with her / And hide her away in a shroud.

author: Christina Rossetti
quote: She gave up beauty in her tender youth, / Gave all her hope and joy and pleasant ways; / She covered up her eyes lest they should gaze / On vanity, and chose the bitter truth.

author: Christina Rossetti
quote: The rose saith in the dewy morn, / I am most fair; / Yet all my loveliness is born / Upon a thorn.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: To thine own self be true, / And it must follow, as the night the day, / Thou canst not then be false to any man.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: Truth is truth / To the end of reckoning.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: O, while you live, tell truth, and shame the Devil!

author: William Shakespeare
quote: But 'tis strange: / And oftentimes, to win us to our harm, / The instruments of darkness tell us truths, / Win us with honest trifles, to betray's / In deepest consequence.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: Truth needs no colour, with his colour fix'd; / Beauty no pencil, beauty's truth to lay; / But best is best, if never intermix'd.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: When my love swears that she is made of truth, / I do believe her, though I know she lies.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: The course of true love never did run smooth.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: Love looks not with the eyes, but with the mind, / And therefore is winged Cupid painted blind.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: If music be the food of love, play on.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: Love is a smoke made with the fume of sighs.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: My bounty is as boundless as the sea, / My love as deep; the more I give to thee, / The more I have, for both are infinite.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: Love sought is good, but given unsought is better.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: Doubt thou the stars are fire; / Doubt that the sun doth move; / Doubt truth to be a liar; / But never doubt I love.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: Love is blind, and lovers cannot see / The pretty follies that themselves commit.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: One half of me is yours, the other half yours1 / Mine own, I would say; but if mine, then yours, / And so all yours.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: Beauty is bought by judgment of the eye.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: Beauty lives with kindness.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: Beauty itself doth of itself persuade the eyes of men without an orator.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: Virtue is beauty, but the beauteous evil are empty trunks o'erflourished by the devil.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: Let witchcraft join with beauty, lust with both!

author: William Shakespeare
quote: For where is any author in the world teaches such beauty as a woman's eye?

author: William Shakespeare
quote: Beauty's a doubtful good, a glass, a flower, lost, faded, broken, dead within an hour; and beauty, blemish'd once, for ever's lost, in spite of physic, painting, pain, and cost.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: Were beauty under twenty locks kept fast, yet love breaks through and picks them all at last.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: The most peerless piece of earth, I think, that e'er the sun shone bright on.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: 'Tis beauty truly blent, whose red and white nature's own sweet and cunning hand laid on.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: Look on beauty, and you shall see 'tis purchased by the weight, which therein works a miracle in nature, making them lightest that wear most of it.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: To me, fair friend, you never can be old, for as you were when first your eye I ey'd, such seems your beauty still.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: If I could write the beauty of your eyes and in fresh numbers number all your graces, the age to come would say, 'This poet lies; such heavenly touches ne'er touch'd earthly faces.'

author: William Shakespeare
quote: See how she leans her cheek upon her hand. O, that I were a glove upon that hand that I might touch that cheek!

author: William Shakespeare
quote: She's beautiful, and therefore to be wooed; she is a woman, therefore to be won.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: What a piece of work is a man, how noble in reason, how infinite in faculties, in form and moving how express and admirable, in action how like an angel, in apprehension how like a god.

author: Henry David Thoreau
quote: Say what you have to say, not what you ought. Any truth is better than make-believe.

author: Henry David Thoreau
quote: Rather than love, than money, than fame, give me truth.

author: Henry David Thoreau
quote: It takes two to speak the truth: one to speak, and another to hear.

author: Henry David Thoreau
quote: Truth never turns to rebuke falsehood; her own straightforwardness is the severest correction.

author: Henry David Thoreau
quote: Truth is always in harmony with herself, and is not concerned chiefly to reveal the justice that may consist with wrong-doing.

author: Henry David Thoreau
quote: The lawyer's truth is not Truth, but consistency or a consistent expediency.

author: Henry David Thoreau
quote: The rarest quality in an epitaph is truth.

author: Henry David Thoreau
quote: There is no remedy for love but to love more.

author: Henry David Thoreau
quote: Love must be as much a light as it is a flame.

author: Henry David Thoreau
quote: Ignorance and bungling with love are better than wisdom and skill without.

author: Henry David Thoreau
quote: I love that one with whom I sympathize.

author: Henry David Thoreau
quote: How insufficient is all wisdom without love.

author: Henry David Thoreau
quote: Love is the profoundest of secrets. Divulged, even to the beloved, it is no longer Love.

author: Henry David Thoreau
quote: The object of love expands and grows before us to eternity, until it includes all that is lovely, and we become all that can love.

author: Henry David Thoreau
quote: A lake is a landscape's most beautiful and expressive feature. It is Earth's eye; looking into which the beholder measures the depth of his own nature.

author: Henry David Thoreau
quote: Beauty is where it is perceived.

author: Henry David Thoreau
quote: The perception of beauty is a moral test.

author: Henry David Thoreau
quote: There is just as much beauty visible to us in the landscape as we are prepared to appreciate, and not a grain more.

author: Henry David Thoreau
quote: Glances of true beauty can be seen in the faces of those who live in true meekness.

author: Aesop
quote: A liar will not be believed, even when he speaks the truth.

author: Aesop
quote: Every truth has two sides; it is as well to look at both, before we commit ourselves to either.

author: Aesop
quote: Appearances are often deceiving.

author: Aesop
quote: No one believes a liar even when he tells the truth.

author: Aesop
quote: Facts speak plainer than words.

author: Aesop
quote: Love can tame the wildest.

author: Aesop
quote: Affairs are easier of entrance than of exit; and it is but common prudence to see our way out before we venture in.

author: Aesop
quote: The Lion was so much in love that he had his claws trimmed and his big teeth taken out for her.

author: Aesop
quote: Do not expect constancy in others if you have none yourself.

author: Aesop
quote: Equals make the best friends.

author: Aesop
quote: It is not only fine feathers that make fine birds.

author: Aesop
quote: Handsome looks are of little worth without sense.

author: Aesop
quote: Outside show is a poor substitute for inner worth.

author: Aesop
quote: A fine coat is not always an indication of an attractive mind.

author: Bashō
quote: There is nothing you can see that is not a flower; there is nothing you can think that is not the moon.

author: Bashō
quote: Do not seek to follow in the footsteps of the wise. Seek what they sought.

author: Bashō
quote: What is important is to keep our mind high in the world of true understanding, and returning to the world of our daily experience to seek therein the truth of beauty.

author: Bashō
quote: Go to the pine if you want to learn about the pine, or to the bamboo if you want to learn about the bamboo. And in doing so, you must leave your subjective preoccupation with yourself.

author: Bashō
quote: Seek not the paths of the ancients; Seek that which the ancients sought.

author: Bashō
quote: Easing in her slender forearm for his pillow

author: Bashō
quote: Leaf-wrapping the rice cakes, with one hand she tucks back her hair

author: Bashō
quote: Girl cat, so thin on love and barley

author: Bashō
quote: Wake, butterfly--it's late, we've miles to go together

author: Bashō
quote: Come, see real flowers of this painful world

author: Bashō
quote: Real poetry is to lead a beautiful life. To live poetry is better than to write it.

author: Bashō
quote: Make the universe your companion, always bearing in mind the true nature of things--mountains and rivers, trees and grasses, and humanity--and enjoy the falling blossoms and the scattering leaves.

author: Bashō
quote: How I long to see among dawn flowers, the face of God.

author: William Hogarth
quote: A great many people seem to delight most in what they least understand.

author: William Hogarth
quote: All the world is competent to judge my pictures except those who are of my profession.

author: William Hogarth
quote: It is by the natural and unaffected movements of the muscles, caused by the passions of the mind, that every man's character would in some measure be written in his face, by the time he arrives at forty years of age.

author: William Hogarth
quote: How great a share variety has in producing beauty may be seen in the ornamental part of nature.

author: William Hogarth
quote: Simplicity, without variety, is wholly insipid.

author: William Hogarth
quote: The serpentine line, or the line of grace, by its waving and winding at the same time different ways, leads the eye in a pleasing manner along the continuity of its variety.

author: William Hogarth
quote: Straight lines vary only in length, and therefore are least ornamental.

author: William Hogarth
quote: It may be imagined that the greatest part of the effects of beauty results from the symmetry of parts in the object, which is beautiful: but I am very well persuaded, this prevailing notion will soon appear to have little or no foundation.

author: Gotthold Ephraim Lessing
quote: The true value of a man is not determined by his possession, supposed or real, of Truth, but rather by his sincere exertion to get to the Truth. It is not possession of the Truth, but rather the pursuit of Truth by which he extends his powers and in which his ever-growing perfectibility is to be found.

author: Gotthold Ephraim Lessing
quote: If God were to hold all Truth concealed in his right hand, and in his left only the steady and diligent drive for Truth, albeit with the proviso that I would always and forever err in the process, and offer me the choice, I would with all humility take the left hand, and say: Father, I will take this one--the pure Truth is for You alone.

author: Gotthold Ephraim Lessing
quote: The search for truth is more precious than its possession.

author: Gotthold Ephraim Lessing
quote: Absolute truth belongs to Thee alone.

author: Gotthold Ephraim Lessing
quote: Let each man say what he deems truth, and let truth itself be commended unto God.

author: Gotthold Ephraim Lessing
quote: Trust no friend without faults, and love a maiden, but no angel.

author: Gotthold Ephraim Lessing
quote: Let us be lazy in everything, except in loving and drinking, except in being lazy.

author: Gotthold Ephraim Lessing
quote: What is a hero without love for mankind?

author: Gotthold Ephraim Lessing
quote: For me the greatest beauty always lies in the greatest clarity.

author: Gotthold Ephraim Lessing
quote: Nature meant woman to be her masterpiece.

author: Gotthold Ephraim Lessing
quote: A blush is the sign which Nature hangs out to show where chastity and honor dwell.

author: Gotthold Ephraim Lessing
quote: The more we see the more we must be able to imagine, and the more we imagine, the more we must think we see.

author: Johann Winckelmann
quote: Unity and simplicity are the two true sources of beauty.

author: Johann Winckelmann
quote: Color contributes to beauty, but it is not beauty. Color should have a minor part in the consideration of beauty, because it is not color but the structure that constitutes its essence.

author: Johann Winckelmann
quote: The only way for us to become great, or even inimitable if possible, is to imitate the Greeks.

author: Johann Winckelmann
quote: Friendship without love is mere acquaintanceship.

author: Johann Winckelmann
quote: From the first moment an indescribable attraction towards you, excited by something more than form and feature, caused me to catch an echo of that harmony which passes human understanding and which is the music of the everlasting concord of things... I was aware of the deep consent of our spirits, the instant I saw you.

author: Johann Winckelmann
quote: No name by which I might call you would be sweet enough or sufficient for my love; all that I could say would be far too feeble to give utterance to my heart and soul. Truly friendship came from heaven and was not created by mere human impulses... My one friend, I love you more than any living thing, and time nor chance nor age can ever lessen this love.

author: Johann Winckelmann
quote: I have noticed that those who are aware only of beauty in women, and are moved little or not at all by the beauty of our sex, seldom have an impartial, innate instinct for the beauty of art. To such a person the beauty of Greek art will ever seem lacking, because its greatest beauty is male rather than female.

author: Johann Winckelmann
quote: Grace can never properly be said to exist without beauty; for it is only in the elegant proportions of beautiful forms that can be found that harmonious variety of line and motion which is the essence and charm of grace.

author: Johann Winckelmann
quote: Expression is an imitation of the active and suffering states of our minds and our bodies and of passions as well as deeds... Stillness is the state most proper to beauty, as it is to the sea, and experience shows that the most beautiful beings are of a still and well-mannered nature.

author: Aristotle
quote: To say of what is that it is not, or of what is not that it is, is false, while to say of what is that it is, and of what is not that it is not, is true.

author: Aristotle
quote: For though we love both the truth and our friends, piety requires us to honor the truth first.

author: Aristotle
quote: The least initial deviation from the truth is multiplied later a thousandfold.

author: Aristotle
quote: Some men are just as sure of the truth of their opinions as are others of what they know.

author: Aristotle
quote: With the truth, all the given facts harmonize; but with what is false, the truth soon hits a wrong note.

author: Aristotle
quote: Love is composed of a single soul inhabiting two bodies.

author: Aristotle
quote: To love someone is to identify with them.

author: Aristotle
quote: Friendship is essentially a partnership.

author: Aristotle
quote: Misfortune shows those who are not really friends.

author: Aristotle
quote: Wishing to be friends is quick work, but friendship is a slow ripening fruit.

author: Aristotle
quote: The chief forms of beauty are order and symmetry and definiteness, which the mathematical sciences demonstrate in a special degree.

author: Aristotle
quote: Beauty depends on size as well as symmetry. No very small animal can be beautiful, for looking at it takes so small a portion of time that the impression of it will be confused. Nor can any very large one, for a whole view of it cannot be had at once, and so there will be no unity and completeness.

author: Aristotle
quote: Beauty is a greater recommendation than any letter of introduction.

author: Aristotle
quote: Suffering becomes beautiful when anyone bears great calamities with cheerfulness, not through insensibility but through greatness of mind.

author: Aristotle
quote: Personal beauty requires that one should be tall; little people may have charm and elegance, but beauty10.

author: Francis Bacon
quote: What is truth? said jesting Pilate; and would not stay for an answer.

author: Francis Bacon
quote: Truth is a naked and open daylight, that doth not show the masks and mummeries and triumphs of the world, half so stately and daintily as candlelights.

author: Francis Bacon
quote: The inquiry of truth, which is the love-making, or wooing of it; the knowledge of truth, which is the presence of it; and the belief of truth, which is the enjoying of it--is the sovereign good of human nature.

author: Francis Bacon
quote: Truth emerges more readily from error than from confusion.

author: Francis Bacon
quote: Truth is the daughter of time, not of authority.

author: Francis Bacon
quote: Science is but an image of the truth.

author: Francis Bacon
quote: No pleasure is comparable to the standing upon the vantage-ground of truth.

author: Francis Bacon
quote: It is impossible to love and to be wise.

author: Francis Bacon
quote: Nuptial love maketh mankind; friendly love perfecteth it; but wanton love corrupteth, and embaseth it.

author: Francis Bacon
quote: For it is a true rule, that love is ever rewarded, either with the reciproque, or with an inward and secret contempt.

author: Francis Bacon
quote: Why should a man be in love with his fetters, though of gold?

author: Francis Bacon
quote: The stage is more beholding to love than the life of man. For as to the stage, love is ever matter of comedies and now and then of tragedies; but in life it doth much mischief, sometimes like a Siren, sometimes like a Fury.

author: Francis Bacon
quote: There is no excellent beauty that hath not some strangeness in the proportion.

author: Francis Bacon
quote: The best part of beauty is that which no picture can express.

author: Francis Bacon
quote: Beauty is as summer fruits, which are easy to corrupt, and cannot last; and for the most part it makes a dissolute youth, and an age a little out of countenance; but yet certainly again, if it light well, it maketh virtue shine, and vices blush.

author: Francis Bacon
quote: Beauty itself is but the sensible image of the Infinite.

author: Francis Bacon
quote: Virtue is like a rich stone, best plain set; and surely virtue is best, in a body that is comely, though not of delicate features; and that hath rather dignity of presence, than beauty of aspect.

author: Robert Graves
quote: Fact is not truth, but a poet who willfully defies fact cannot achieve truth.

author: Robert Graves
quote: His function is truth, whereas the scholar's is fact. Fact is not to be gainsaid; one may put it in this way, that fact is a Tribune of the People with no legislative right, but only the right of veto.

author: Robert Graves
quote: Truth-loving Persians do not dwell upon the trivial skirmish fought near Marathon.

author: Robert Graves
quote: Love is a universal migraine. A bright stain on the vision, blotting out reason.

author: Robert Graves
quote: Love is a universal migraine. A bright stain on the vision Blotting out reason.

author: Robert Graves
quote: Lovers to-day and for all time preserve the meaning of my rhyme: Love is not kindly nor yet grim but does to you as you to him.

author: Robert Graves
quote: Love and honor. They are the two great things, and now they're dimmed and blighted. Today, love is just sex and sentimentality. Love is really a recognition of truth, a recognition of another person's integrity and truth in a way that... makes both of you light up when you recognize the quality in the other. That's what love is. It's a recognition of singularity... And love is giving and giving and giving... not looking for any return. Until you do that, you can't love.

author: Robert Graves
quote: Love at first sight'some say misnaming discovery of twinned helplessness against the huge tug of procreation. But friendship at first sight? This also catches fiercely at the surprised heart so that the cheek blanches then blushes.

author: Robert Graves
quote: As you are woman, so be lovely: As you are lovely, so be various, merciful as constant, constant as various, so be mine, as I yours for ever.

author: Robert Graves
quote: As you are woman, so be lovely: As you are lovely, so be various, Merciful as constant, constant as various, So be mine, as I yours for ever.

author: Robert Graves
quote: Take your delight in momentariness, Walk between dark and dark a shining space With the grave's narrowness, though not its peace.

author: Robert Graves
quote: She tells her love while half asleep, In the dark hours, With half-words whispered low: As Earth stirs in her winter sleep And puts out grass and flowers Despite the snow, Despite the falling snow.

author: L. M. Montgomery
quote: Truth exists, only lies have to be invented.

author: L. M. Montgomery
quote: Gossip lies nine times and tells a half truth the tenth.

author: L. M. Montgomery
quote: Ye shall know the truth and the truth shall make you free.

author: L. M. Montgomery
quote: A woman who has a sense of humor possesses no refuge from the merciless truth about herself.

author: L. M. Montgomery
quote: Don't believe in imagining things different from what they really are.

author: L. M. Montgomery
quote: I don't want sunbursts or marble halls, I just want you.

author: L. M. Montgomery
quote: Perhaps, after all, romance did not come into one's life with pomp and blare, like a gay knight riding down; perhaps it crept to one's side like an old friend through quiet ways; perhaps... love unfolded naturally out of a beautiful friendship, as a golden-hearted rose slipping from its green sheath.

author: L. M. Montgomery
quote: To love is easy and therefore common--but to understand--how rare it is!

author: L. M. Montgomery
quote: I think... that we always love best the people who need us.

author: L. M. Montgomery
quote: You were never poor as long as you had something to love.

author: L. M. Montgomery
quote: I'm so thankful for friendship. It beautifies life so much.

author: L. M. Montgomery
quote: I love pretty things; and I hate to look in the glass and see something that isn't pretty. It makes me feel so sorrowful--just as I feel when I look at any ugly thing. I pity it because it isn't beautiful.

author: L. M. Montgomery
quote: Brains last, beauty doesn't.

author: L. M. Montgomery
quote: There is so much in the world for us all if we only have the eyes to see it, and the heart to love it, and the hand to gather it to ourselves--so much in men and women, so much in art and literature, so much everywhere in which to delight, and for which to be thankful.

author: L. M. Montgomery
quote: Night is beautiful when you are happy--comforting when you are in grief--terrible when you are lonely and unhappy.

author: Maya Angelou
quote: There's a world of difference between truth and facts. Facts can obscure the truth.

author: Maya Angelou
quote: The truth brings the past into the present and prepares us for the future. That's what truth does.

author: Maya Angelou
quote: Let me tell so much truth. I want to tell the truth in my work. The truth will lead me to all.

author: Maya Angelou
quote: The truth is very important. No matter how negative it is, it is imperative that you learn the truth, not necessarily the facts. I mean, that, that can come, but facts can stand in front of the truth and almost obscure the truth. It is imperative that students learn the truth of our history.

author: Maya Angelou
quote: Never let the facts alone obscure the truth of your narrative. The truth is what your life really felt like.

author: Maya Angelou
quote: Love recognizes no barriers. It jumps hurdles, leaps fences, penetrates walls to arrive at its destination full of hope.

author: Maya Angelou
quote: In the flush of love's light, we dare be brave. And suddenly we see that love costs all we are and will ever be. Yet it is only love which sets us free.

author: Maya Angelou
quote: I know for sure that love saves me and that it is here to save us all.

author: Maya Angelou
quote: Love is like a virus. It can happen to anybody at any time.

author: Maya Angelou
quote: Have enough courage to trust love one more time and always one more time.

author: Maya Angelou
quote: If you have only one smile in you, give it to the people you love.

author: Maya Angelou
quote: In all the world, there is no heart for me like yours. In all the world, there is no love for you like mine.

author: Maya Angelou
quote: We delight in the beauty of the butterfly, but rarely admit the changes it has gone through to achieve that beauty.

author: Maya Angelou
quote: Open your eyes to the beauty around you, open your mind to the wonders of life, open your heart to those who love you, and always be true to yourself.

author: Maya Angelou
quote: In diversity there is beauty and there is strength.

author: Maya Angelou
quote: You alone are enough. You have nothing to prove to anybody.

author: Maya Angelou
quote: Success is liking yourself, liking what you do, and liking how you do it.

author: Chinua Achebe
quote: There is no story that is not true.

author: Chinua Achebe
quote: If you only hear one side of the story, you have no understanding at all.

author: Chinua Achebe
quote: One of the truest tests of integrity is its blunt refusal to be compromised.

author: Chinua Achebe
quote: Until the lions have their own historians, the history of the hunt will always glorify the hunter.

author: Chinua Achebe
quote: In the end I began to understand. There is such a thing as absolute power over narrative.

author: Chinua Achebe
quote: If I hold her hand she says, 'Don't touch!' If I hold her foot she says 'Don't touch!' But when I hold her waist-beads she pretends not to know.

author: Chinua Achebe
quote: Until Obi met Clara on board the cargo boat Sasa he had thought of love as another grossly over-rated European invention.

author: Chinua Achebe
quote: I can't marry you," she said suddenly, as Obi tried to kiss her under the tall frangipani tree at the edge of the swimming pool, and exploded into tears.

author: Chinua Achebe
quote: Not, even my mother can stop me," he said as he lay down beside Joseph.

author: Chinua Achebe
quote: It was scandalous that, in the middle of the twentieth century, a man could be barred from marrying a girl simply because her great-great-great-great-grandfather had been dedicated to serve a god.

author: Chinua Achebe
quote: She looked at each in turn with a strained smile on her countenance. 'Truth is beauty, isn't it? It must be you know to make someone dying in that pain, to make him ... smile. He sees it and it is ... How can I say it? ... It is unbearably, yes unbearably beautiful.'

author: Chinua Achebe
quote: Among the Igbo the art of conversation is regarded very highly, and proverbs are the palm-oil with which words are eaten.

author: Chinua Achebe
quote: 'Heart of Darkness' projects the image of Africa as 'the other world,' the antithesis of Europe and therefore of civilization, a place where a man's vaunted intelligence and refinement are finally mocked by triumphant bestiality.

author: Chinua Achebe
quote: Aha! Come to think of it, that might explain the insistence of the oppressed that the oppressor must not be allowed to camouflage his appearance or confuse the poor by stealing and masquerading in their clothes. Perhaps it is the demand of that primitive integrity of the earth... Or, who knows, it might also be something less innocent (for the earth does have its streak of peasant cunning)--an insistence that your badge of privilege must never leave your breast, nor your coat of many colours your back...so that...on the wrathful day of reckoning...you will be as conspicuous as a peacock!

author: Toni Morrison
quote: No matter how hard we try to ignore it, the mind always knows truth and wants clarity.

author: Toni Morrison
quote: The truth doesn't have to be beautiful. It just has to be true.

author: Toni Morrison
quote: There is no one single truth; there are multiple truths.

author: Toni Morrison
quote: All the stories are true.

author: Toni Morrison
quote: We substituted good grammar for intellect; we switched habits to simulate maturity; we rearranged lies and called it truth, seeing in the new pattern of an old idea the Revelation and the Word.

author: Toni Morrison
quote: Love is or it ain't. Thin love ain't love at all.

author: Toni Morrison
quote: Don't ever think I fell for you, or fell over you. I didn't fall in love, I rose in it.

author: Toni Morrison
quote: Love is never any better than the lover.

author: Toni Morrison
quote: Love is divine only and difficult always. If you think it is easy you are a fool. If you think it is natural you are blind.

author: Toni Morrison
quote: You can't own a human being. You can't lose what you don't own.

author: Toni Morrison
quote: Beauty was not simply something to behold; it was something one could do.

author: Toni Morrison
quote: At some point in life the world's beauty becomes enough. You don't need to photograph, paint, or even remember it. It is enough.

author: Toni Morrison
quote: Along with the idea of romantic love, she was introduced to another--physical beauty. Probably the most destructive ideas in the history of human thought. Both originated in envy, thrived in insecurity, and ended in disillusion.

author: Toni Morrison
quote: You looked at them and wondered why they were so ugly; you looked closely and could not find the source. Then you realized that it came from conviction, their conviction.

author: Toni Morrison
quote: Here was an ugly little girl asking for beauty... A little black girl who wanted to rise up out of the pit of her blackness and see the world with blue eyes.

author: Pablo Neruda
quote: The Truth is in the prologue. Death to the romantic fool, the expert in solitary confinement.
