author: Mahmoud Darwish
quote: What doesn't resemble me is more beautiful.

author: Mahmoud Darwish
quote: I love women whose hidden desires make horses put an end to their lives at the threshold.

author: Yehuda Amichai
quote: There are two languages: one as things seem to us and the other of knowledge.

author: Yehuda Amichai
quote: The fool is the one who insists on his truth to the exclusion of others. And after all, truth, beauty, the very meaning of words ll these are relative values.

author: Yehuda Amichai
quote: Words inflate like money: the more they're printed, the more value they lose.

author: Yehuda Amichai
quote: Love is not the last room: there are others after it, the whole length of the corridor that has no end.

author: Yehuda Amichai
quote: And as we stray further from love, we multiply the words. Had we remained together we could have become a silence.

author: Yehuda Amichai
quote: Love is like a reservoir of kindness and pleasure, like silos and pools during a siege.

author: Yehuda Amichai
quote: Yes, all of this is sorrow. But leave a little love burning always like the small bulb in the room of a sleeping baby that gives him a bit of security and quiet love though he doesnt know what the light is or where it comes from.

author: Yehuda Amichai
quote: Look, just as time isn't inside clocks love isn't inside bodies: bodies only tell the love.

author: Yehuda Amichai
quote: The beauty of an iceberg is under-water; it is not in its mind-set.

author: Yehuda Amichai
quote: Lovely is the world rising early to evil, / Lovely is the world falling asleep to sin and pity, / In the mingling of ourselves, you and I, / Lovely is the world.

author: Yehuda Amichai
quote: Behind all this, some great happiness is hiding.

author: Yehuda Amichai
quote: From the place where we are right / Flowers will never grow / In the spring.

author: Yehuda Amichai
quote: But the world is beautifully made for doing good and for resting, like a park bench.

author: Forugh Farrokhzad
quote: Everyone knows. Everyone knows that you and I, In the prairies and the plains-- reached to the glittering roots-- of Truth.

author: Forugh Farrokhzad
quote: Perhaps the truth was those two young hands, those young hands buried beneath snow--

author: Forugh Farrokhzad
quote: Sound, sound, only sound remains. In a world of runts, measurements orbit around zero. Why must I stop?

author: Forugh Farrokhzad
quote: I am that candle which illumines a ruin with the burning of her heart.

author: Forugh Farrokhzad
quote: I discovered I must must must love, insanely.

author: Forugh Farrokhzad
quote: My nights are painted bright with your dream, sweet love, and heavy with your fragrance is my breast.

author: Forugh Farrokhzad
quote: You are the heartbeat of my burning body; a fire blazing in the shade of my eyelashes.

author: Forugh Farrokhzad
quote: You are more bountiful than the wheat fields, more fruit-laden than the golden boughs.

author: Forugh Farrokhzad
quote: You are my breath of life, sweet love, you have brought me back to life from the grave.

author: Forugh Farrokhzad
quote: You are hidden under my skin, flowing through my every cell.

author: Forugh Farrokhzad
quote: Ever since love was awakened in my heart, I have become total devotion with desire.

author: Forugh Farrokhzad
quote: I am so filled with you I want to run through meadows, bash my head against mountain rocks, give myself to ocean waves.

author: Forugh Farrokhzad
quote: I am so filled with you I want to crumble into myself like a speck of dust, to gently lay my head at your feet, cling fast to your weightless shadow.

author: Forugh Farrokhzad
quote: Beautiful is the silence of ruins, as if she herself lived among the ruins.

author: Forugh Farrokhzad
quote: I know a sad little fairy who lives in the sea and plays the wooden flute of her heart tenderly, tenderly...

author: Forugh Farrokhzad
quote: I plant my hands in the garden soil-- I will sprout, I know, I know, I know.

author: Forugh Farrokhzad
quote: I do not speak of anxious murmurs in the dark-- I speak of daylight, of open windows, fresh air, and a stove in which burn useless things; of an earth pregnant with new seedlings, of birth, maturation, and pride.

author: Forugh Farrokhzad
quote: One window is enough for me.

author: Saadi Shirazi
quote: If thou art wise, incline to truth; for truth, not the semblance, remains in its place.

author: Saadi Shirazi
quote: To tell a falsehood is like the cut of a saber: for though the wound may heal, the scar of it will remain.

author: Saadi Shirazi
quote: A peace-mingling falsehood is preferable to a mischief-stirring truth.

author: Saadi Shirazi
quote: One habitually speaking the truth is pardoned when he once makes a slip. But if he becomes noted for lying, people do not believe him even when speaking truth.

author: Saadi Shirazi
quote: A falsehood resulting in conciliation is better than a truth producing trouble.

author: Saadi Shirazi
quote: The rose and the thorn, and sorrow and gladness are linked together.

author: Saadi Shirazi
quote: In Love there are no days or nights, For lovers it is all the same. The musicians have gone, yet the Sufis listen; In Love there is a beginning but no end. Each has a name for his Beloved, But for me my Beloved is nameless. Sa'di, if you destroy an idol, Then destroy the idol of the self.

author: Saadi Shirazi
quote: The path of love is not a tedious path.

author: Saadi Shirazi
quote: A good deed is never lost; he who sows courtesy reaps friendship, and he who plants kindness gathers love.

author: Saadi Shirazi
quote: Lovers are killed by those they love so well; No voices from the slain return.

author: Saadi Shirazi
quote: Whatever makes an impression on the heart seems lovely in the eye.

author: Saadi Shirazi
quote: A garden is a delight to the eye and a solace for the soul.

author: Saadi Shirazi
quote: A handsome woman is a jewel; a good woman is a treasure.

author: Saadi Shirazi
quote: Joy and sorrow, beauty and deformity, equally pass away.

author: Omar Khayyam
quote: We are in truth but pieces on this chess board of life, which in the end we leave, only to drop one by one into the grave of nothingness.

author: Omar Khayyam
quote: A hair divides what is false and true.

author: Omar Khayyam
quote: The moving finger writes; and, having writ, moves on: nor all thy piety nor wit shall lure it back to cancel half a line, nor all thy tears wash out a word of it.

author: Omar Khayyam
quote: The world is neither good nor evil; it is the way we perceive it that makes it so.

author: Omar Khayyam
quote: How sad, a heart that does not know how to love, that does not know what it is to be drunk with love. If you are not in love, how can you enjoy the blinding light of the sun, the soft light of the moon?

author: Omar Khayyam
quote: It's too bad if a heart lacks fire, and is deprived of the light of a heart ablaze. The day on which you are without passionate love is the most wasted day of your life.

author: Omar Khayyam
quote: Be happy for this moment. This moment is your life.

author: Omar Khayyam
quote: Drink wine. This is life eternal. This is all that youth will give you. It is the season for wine, roses and drunken friends. Be happy for this moment. This moment is your life.

author: Omar Khayyam
quote: A book of verses underneath the bough, a jug of wine, a loaf of bread, and thou beside me singing in the wilderness.

author: Omar Khayyam
quote: Hearts are like tapers, which at beauteous eyes / Kindle a flame of love that never dies; / And beauty is a flame, where hearts, like moths, / Offer themselves a burning sacrifice.

author: Omar Khayyam
quote: The rose that once has bloomed forever dies.

author: Omar Khayyam
quote: A loaf of bread, a jug of wine, and thou.

author: Yunus Emre
quote: True speech is the fruit of not speaking. Too much talking clouds the heart.

author: Yunus Emre
quote: Whatever separates you from the Truth, throw it away, it will vanish anyhow.

author: Yunus Emre
quote: The Truth fills the world, but to whom is Truth known? You ask so much of It, but It isn't separate from yourself.

author: Yunus Emre
quote: I tried to make sense of the Four Books, until love arrived, and it all became a single syllable.

author: Yunus Emre
quote: A single word can brighten the face of one who knows the value of words. Ripened in silence, a single word acquires a great energy for work.

author: Yunus Emre
quote: Your love has wrested me away from me, / You're the one I need, you're the one I crave.

author: Yunus Emre
quote: If I told you about a land of love, / friend, would you follow me and come?

author: Yunus Emre
quote: To love the world is to be afflicted.

author: Yunus Emre
quote: Love is the water of life; drink it down with heart and soul.

author: Yunus Emre
quote: Let your heart be filled with love, for love is the essence of all creation.

author: Yunus Emre
quote: Do not judge a person by their external appearance, for true beauty lies within the heart.

author: Yunus Emre
quote: The world is full of beauty, if only we take the time to appreciate it.

author: Yunus Emre
quote: Kindness is the language of the heart, it knows no boundaries.

author: Yunus Emre
quote: Simplicity is the key to a fulfilled life. Let go of material possessions and find joy in the simple things.

author: Yunus Emre
quote: The beauty of poetry lies not in the words themselves, but in the emotions they evoke.

author: Ibn Khaldun
quote: No one can stand up against the authority of truth, and the evil of falsehood is to be fought with enlightening speculation.

author: Ibn Khaldun
quote: If the soul is impartial in receiving information, it devotes to that information the share of critical investigation the information deserves, and its truth or untruth thus becomes clear. However, if the soul is infected with partisanship for a particular opinion or sect, it accepts without a moment's hesitation the information that is agreeable to it. Prejudice and partisanship obscure the critical faculty and preclude critical investigation. The result is that falsehoods are accepted and transmitted.

author: Ibn Khaldun
quote: The intellect (mind), indeed, is a correct scale. Its indications are completely certain and in no way wrong. However, the intellect should not be used to weigh such matters as the oneness of God, the other world, the truth of prophecy, the real character of the divine attributes, or anything else that lies beyond the level of the intellect. That would mean to desire the impossible.

author: Ibn Khaldun
quote: The inner meaning of history... involves speculation and an attempt to get at the truth, subtle explanation of the causes and origins of existing things, and deep knowledge of the how and why of events.

author: Ibn Khaldun
quote: Blindly following ancient customs and traditions doesn't mean that the dead are alive, but that the living are dead.

author: Ibn Khaldun
quote: Man is the child of customs, not the child of his ancestors.

author: Ibn Khaldun
quote: Habits are qualities of the soul.

author: Ibn Khaldun
quote: The bond of intimacy is what gives a group its self-sacrificial ethos. Intimacy is what binds people together: In love, in family, in protection, in fulfilling duties and obligations to others just as they had done to you.

author: Ibn Khaldun
quote: It is only in the family we can find the purest reflection of love, compassion, and justice.

author: Ibn Khaldun
quote: In the case of all human qualities, the extremes are reprehensible, and the middle road is praiseworthy.

author: Ibn Khaldun
quote: Happiness and profit are achieved mostly by people who are obsequious and use flattery. Such character disposition is one of the reasons for happiness.

author: Ibn Khaldun
quote: People justify their own subservience to pleasure by citing men and women of the past who allegedly did the same things they are doing.

author: Abai Kunanbay
quote: Allah is the truth, the word is the truth, truth is never false.

author: Abai Kunanbay
quote: A just cause need not fear the test of reason.

author: Abai Kunanbay
quote: Seek to direct [the multitude] onto the path of truth.

author: Abai Kunanbay
quote: Truth cannot be attained unless the soul has a love of it.

author: Abai Kunanbay
quote: The verity is still called the truth, and the truth is Allah.

author: Abai Kunanbay
quote: Only a love born of clear understanding, infinite faith and a sense of gratitude to Allah for creating human beings with much love and endowing them in turn with the capacity to love and feel pity only this can be called the true love for the Most High.

author: Abai Kunanbay
quote: Allah has created humankind with love, so love it more than you do yourself!

author: Abai Kunanbay
quote: Without love, life is empty.

author: Abai Kunanbay
quote: Love engenders aspiration and understanding, while reason, intelligence and loving kindness kindle an interest in learning.

author: Abai Kunanbay
quote: The duty of human beings is to love the Creator who created them with love. Furthermore, a human being should love all other human beings as brothers and sisters, as well as loving justice.

author: Abai Kunanbay
quote: Man's merits lie not in his appearance, but in the purity of his mind, in his spiritual essence, for it is by this that Allah distinguishes amongst us.

author: Abai Kunanbay
quote: Mind, education, honour and charm make a man handsome and strong. Nothing more.

author: Abai Kunanbay
quote: A person should dress modestly, keep clothes clean and be neat. Spending on clothing more than it is allowed, burdening yourselves with too much care can only [be for] dandies.

author: Abai Kunanbay
quote: The dignity of a man is not determined by appearance and income. Allah judges a man by his heart and mind.

author: Zhuangzi
quote: Once upon a time, I dreamt I was a butterfly, fluttering hither and thither, to all intents and purposes a butterfly. I was conscious only of my happiness as a butterfly, unaware that I was myself. Soon I awaked, and there I was, veritably myself again. Now I do not know whether I was then a man dreaming I was a butterfly, or whether I am now a butterfly dreaming I am a man.

author: Zhuangzi
quote: Right is not right; so is not so. If right were really right, it would differ so clearly from not right that there would be no need for argument. If so were really so, it would differ so clearly from not so that there would be no need for argument.

author: Zhuangzi
quote: The purpose of a fish trap is to catch fish, and when the fish are caught, the trap is forgotten. The purpose of words is to convey ideas. When the ideas are grasped, the words are forgotten. Where can I find a man who has forgotten words so I can talk with him?

author: Zhuangzi
quote: Men honor what lies within the sphere of their knowledge, but do not realize how dependent they are on what lies beyond it.

author: Zhuangzi
quote: To be truly ignorant, be content with your own knowledge.

author: Zhuangzi
quote: The love of a Sage for his fellows likewise finds expression amongst mankind. Were he not told so, he would not know that he loved his fellows. But whether he knows it or whether he does not know it, whether he hears it or whether he does not hear it, his love for his is without end, and mankind cease not to repose therein.

author: Zhuangzi
quote: Sorrow and happiness are the heresies of virtue; joy and anger lead astray from Tao; love and hate cause loss of virtue. The heart unconscious of sorrow and happiness--that is perfect virtue.

author: Zhuangzi
quote: Love of colors bewilders the eye and it fails to see right. Love of harmonies bewitches the ear, and it loses its true hearing. Love of perfumes fills the head with dizziness. Love of flavors ruins the taste. Desires unsettle the heart until the original nature runs amok.

author: Zhuangzi
quote: All existing things are really one. We regard those that are beautiful and rare as valuable, and those that are ugly as foul and rotten. The foul and rotten may come to be transformed into what is rare and valuable, and the rare and valuable into what is foul and rotten.

author: Zhuangzi
quote: Eyes that are blind have no way to tell the loveliness of faces and features; eyes with no pupils have no way to tell the beauty of colored and embroidered silks.

author: Zhuangzi
quote: We can't expect a blind man to appreciate beautiful patterns or a deaf man to listen to bells and drums. And blindness and deafness are not confined to the body alone--the understanding has them, too.

author: Zhuangzi
quote: The World is Large--Its beauty indescribable.

author: Wang Wei
quote: Seated alone by shadowy bamboos, I strum my lyre and laugh aloud; None know that I am here, deep in the woods; Only the bright moon comes to shine on me.

author: Wang Wei
quote: To be a stranger in a strange land: Whenever one feasts, one thinks of one's brother twice as much as before, There where my brother far away is ascending, The dogwood is flowering, and a man is missed.

author: Wang Wei
quote: The autumn hill gathers the remaining light, A flying bird chases after its companion. The green color is bright And brings me into the moment, like a sunset mist that has no fixed place.

author: Wang Wei
quote: Red beans grow in southern lands; / In spring, how many branches sprout? / I hope you gather them in plenty-- / These things best evoke longing.

author: Wang Wei
quote: Here in the hills, I bade you farewell; / At dusk, I close my wooden gate. / Next spring, the grass will be green again-- / Will you return, my noble friend?

author: Wang Wei
quote: Since beauty is honoured all over the Empire, How could Xi Shi remain humbly at home?

author: Wang Wei
quote: And the more the King loved her, the lovelier she looked, Blinding him away from wisdom.

author: Wang Wei
quote: O Hsiang-yang, how your beautiful days Make drunken my old mountain-heart!

author: Wang Wei
quote: Down in my heart I have always been as pure As this limpid water is.

author: Xu Zhimo
quote: If the materialistic West is a civilisation without a heart, as we are accustomed to regard it nowadays, ours, on the other hand, is one without a soul.

author: Xu Zhimo
quote: The search for religion is the starting point of thought.

author: Xu Zhimo
quote: If the truth is a hurt, choose a lie. If a lie is a hurt, choose silence. If silence is a harm, choose to leave.

author: Xu Zhimo
quote: At least once in a lifetime, forget yourself for someone. Not expecting results, not seeking companionship, not seeking possession, not even asking for their love. Only to meet them in your most beautiful years.

author: Xu Zhimo
quote: Love is the center and essence of life; the success of love is the success of life, and the failure of love is the failure of life.

author: Xu Zhimo
quote: Love is not the possession of a person; it is the sharing of a passion.

author: Xu Zhimo
quote: I am a cloud in the sky, that shadows your stirred heart by chance. No need for you to feel surprise, still less to be delighted, in a flash, every trace of me will be gone.

author: Xu Zhimo
quote: I have a love affair; I love stars in the sky; I love their sparkle: No such a miracle in the world.

author: Xu Zhimo
quote: Oh, roses, red roses that conquer all other beauties. The thunder storm of last night, that is the signal of your birth. The smile of your cheeks, that is brought, from Heaven.

author: Xu Zhimo
quote: Love, is transcendental and transfiguring, and being transfigured through that mysterious force, one's mortal eyes.

author: Xu Zhimo
quote: The golden willows by the riverside are young brides in the setting sun; their reflections on the shimmering waves always linger in the depth of my heart.

author: Xu Zhimo
quote: There are times when our little courtyard ripples with infinite tenderness: Winsome wisteria, bosom bared, invites the caress of persimmon leaves.

author: Qiu Jin
quote: Don't tell me women are not the stuff of heroes.

author: Qiu Jin
quote: The young intellectuals are all chanting, 'Revolution, Revolution,' but I say the revolution will have to start in our homes, by achieving equal rights for women.

author: Qiu Jin
quote: Sun and moon have no light left, earth is dark; Our women's world is sunk so deep, who can help us?

author: Qiu Jin
quote: In the vast, worldly dust, where can I find my soulmate? My robe is stained with tears!

author: Qiu Jin
quote: When no one else shares my tune, what is the point of sighing? To meet a soulmate who knows the same songs, I'd willingly die.

author: Qiu Jin
quote: Oh, this poor handkerchief made of merfolk-woven silk, half stained with blood and half soaked in tears.

author: Qiu Jin
quote: Bitterly forced to behave as a wife with painted brows, I'm full of disdain!

author: Qiu Jin
quote: I desire that they be leaders, awakened lions, advance messengers of learning and intelligence; that they may serve as rafts crossing cloudy ferries; as lamps in dark chambers. That they may let shine, from the center of women's realm in our country, bright light resplendent, glittering rare in the beauty of its color; that on the whole earth globe, they startle the hearts, snatch the eyes of men, causing all to applaud, rejoice.

author: Qiu Jin
quote: To often toss aside needlework for a love of music. To always strip off hair ornaments to pay for books.

author: Kim Sowol
quote: I call your name till it breaks my heart

author: Kim Sowol
quote: Standing here I may turn into stone but I will call your name till I die

author: Kim Sowol
quote: When you leave, weary of me, without a word I shall gently let you go.

author: Kim Sowol
quote: I will be calling you till my death, even if I be turned into a stone, my love! My dear love!

author: Kim Sowol
quote: Miss you. Should I say it, I would only miss you more.

author: Kim Sowol
quote: When you go away, sick of seeing me, though I die; No, I shall not shed a tear.

author: Kim Sowol
quote: On a mountain flowers open, each flower opens, regardless of fall spring and summer, each flower opens.

author: Kim Sowol
quote: The unforgettable memory comes back again when the silken mist spreads over the snow.

author: Kim Sowol
quote: O name shattered in pieces: A name vanished in the air: A name with no response Yet will I be calling it, till I die.

author: Han Kang
quote: Is it true that human beings are fundamentally cruel? Is the experience of cruelty the only thing we share as a species? Is the dignity that we cling to nothing but self-delusion, masking from ourselves the single truth: that each one of us is capable of being reduced to an insect, a ravening beast, a lump of meat? To be degraded, slaughtered--is this the essential of humankind, one which history has confirmed as inevitable?

author: Han Kang
quote: There are certain memories that remain inviolate to the ravages of time. And to those of suffering. It is not true that everything is colored by time and suffering. It is not true that they bring everything to ruin.

author: Han Kang
quote: Glass is transparent, right? And fragile. That's the fundamental nature of glass. And that's why objects that are made of glass have to be handled with care. After all, if they end up smashed or cracked or chipped, then they're good for nothing, right, you just have to chuck them away. Before, we used to have a kind of glass that couldn't be broken. A truth so hard and clear it might as well have been made of glass. So when you think about it, it was only when we were shattered that we proved we had souls. That what we really were was humans made of glass.

author: Han Kang
quote: Some memories never heal. Rather than fading with the passage of time, those memories become the only things that are left behind when all else is abraded.

author: Han Kang
quote: Language has a way of slipping through when attempts are made to grip, control or suppress it. So whatever happens, truths of some form will be spoken. I believe this power of language will remain unchanged in the future.

author: Han Kang
quote: Where is love? It is inside my thump-thumping beating chest. What is love? It is the gold thread connecting between our hearts.

author: Han Kang
quote: When I write, I use my body... I try to infuse those vivid sensations that I feel as a mortal being with blood coursing through her body into my sentences. As if I am sending out an electric current.

author: Han Kang
quote: It was around then that I realized for the first time that falling in love is like being haunted. Even before I opened my eyes in the morning, you would slip in under my eyelids.

author: Han Kang
quote: I believe that trauma is something to be embraced rather than healed or recovered from... through our pained and silent embrace of it over the course of a whole life, life is, perhaps paradoxically, made possible.

author: Han Kang
quote: This was the body of a beautiful young woman, conventionally an object of desire, and yet it was a body from which all desire had been eliminated.

author: Han Kang
quote: Unable to fathom what on earth it could be, this thing so cold, so hostile. This vanishing fragility, this oppressive weight of beauty.

author: Han Kang
quote: You said, Beauty is only that which is intense, has a vibrant energy. You said, This thing we call life mustn't ever become something endured.

author: Han Kang
quote: As for women who were pretty, intelligent, strikingly sensual, the daughters of rich families--they would only have served to disrupt my carefully ordered existence.

author: Laxmi Prasad Devkota
quote: Art is the beautiful illustration of Truth from the creative imagination. The truth is in our life and unless it comes from the formlessness to the form we do not realize it.

author: Laxmi Prasad Devkota
quote: Even Truth is of many types, like - Imaginative Truth, Practical Truth and Philosophical Truth. That which is in three times, that is called Truth and God itself is the first and the last truth. But in practical life, truth takes many forms and as the practical truth I understand the sensible world's hard comprehensible truth. The one attained by the research of intellect, I call philosophical truth and imaginative that which illustrates through the subtle pictures of the mind. To say the stone is hard is practical truth, saying that adding up one and one the result will be two and through the existence of creation there is truth I call philosophical truth; and saying things like seeing Sarasvati talked with her, I understand as being the imaginative truth. For me, practicality is limited; philosophy, intellect is blind; I enjoy imaginative truth the most and through it find the glimpses of God.

author: Laxmi Prasad Devkota
quote: In the divine talent of the Creator the word got born and we, by studying this creation attain clear messages of Divine Conscience, Divine Truth, Divine Beauty and Divine knowledge.

author: Laxmi Prasad Devkota
quote: To doubt is better, because it helps understand, aids searching. Question is everything, answer is maturity.

author: Laxmi Prasad Devkota
quote: Truth shines through feelings... But in the heart there is the brightness of God. I assume feelings or emotions as primary, desiring and thinking come later.

author: Laxmi Prasad Devkota
quote: The chief element of creation is love and the chief action of love is Art.

author: Laxmi Prasad Devkota
quote: A man's greatness is determined by his heart not by the caste and the lineage he brings.

author: Laxmi Prasad Devkota
quote: I see sounds, I hear sights, I taste smells, I touch not heaven but things from the underworld, things people do not believe exist, whose shapes the world does not suspect.

author: Laxmi Prasad Devkota
quote: We realize the 'beautiful' through the sensing of Truth and where there is no Truth there isn't beauty.

author: Laxmi Prasad Devkota
quote: When the creative imagination sees new dreams rising above from imitation and maneuvers its works in its own manner, there Art springs.

author: Amrita Pritam
quote: Come! let us take a moment's shelter under some roof. Look! there--before you, a little way off. There is an empty space between truth and falsehood.

author: Amrita Pritam
quote: Look further on ahead, between truth and falsehood--a little empty space.

author: Amrita Pritam
quote: Love, like the Infinite Self, is an eternal Truth; the poet is closer to Nature and Nature is Truth; when the poet's ears are at one with the heartbeat of Nature, he hears the beat of love, the eternal Truth.

author: Amrita Pritam
quote: The hope of love weighs more than life sometimes.

author: Amrita Pritam
quote: The heart that loves is always young.

author: Amrita Pritam
quote: Not even god can save you from the destruction of love.

author: Amrita Pritam
quote: If you are a poet, your heart is a burning candle; if you are a lover, your soul is an endless flame.

author: Amrita Pritam
quote: Love is not written on paper, for paper can be erased.

author: Amrita Pritam
quote: Love is the only flame that can never be extinguished by the winds of time.

author: Amrita Pritam
quote: Love is not a temporary emotion; it is an eternal connection.

author: Amrita Pritam
quote: The heart knows no boundaries; it only knows the language of love.

author: Amrita Pritam
quote: The beauty of love lies in its imperfections.

author: Amrita Pritam
quote: A woman's worth is not measured by her appearance but by the depth of her thoughts and the power of her spirit.

author: Amrita Pritam
quote: Feminism is the art of unlearning the prejudices ingrained in society and relearning the beauty of equality.

author: Amrita Pritam
quote: Where the dance of Meera and the silence of Buddha meet, blossoms the true philosophy of Rajneesh.

author: Kalidasa
quote: Truth is God himself; Truth is the highest vow.

author: Kalidasa
quote: The path of truth is often a lonely one.

author: Kalidasa
quote: The earth is supported by the power of truth; it is the power of truth that makes the sun shine and the winds blow.

author: Kalidasa
quote: The heart of a good man is like the sun and the moon, it radiates goodness in every direction.

author: Kalidasa
quote: The mind is the source of all suffering and the source of all happiness.

author: Kalidasa
quote: Love, once awakened, knows no bounds. It transcends lifetimes and carries the fragrance of eternity.

author: Kalidasa
quote: A thought is as vivid as an act, to a lover.

author: Kalidasa
quote: Grief must be shared to be endured.

author: Kalidasa
quote: The flame of love is now just a flicker in the wind, but it can be rekindled with forgiveness.

author: Kalidasa
quote: A life of love is one of continual growth, where the doors and windows of experience are always open to the wonder and magic that life offers.

author: Kalidasa
quote: Beauty is not just in the eyes but in the soul.

author: Kalidasa
quote: The bloom of youth is ephemeral like the morning dew.

author: Kalidasa
quote: A woman's beauty is like a flower. It fades with time, but its fragrance lingers on.

author: Kalidasa
quote: The lotus flower blooms most beautifully from the deepest and thickest mud.

author: Kalidasa
quote: The moon makes the sky beautiful, just as the beautiful women make the world attractive.

author: Akka Mahadevi
quote: Like treasure hidden in the ground, like flavor in the fruit, like gold in the rock, and oil in the seed, the Absolute is hidden in the heart.

author: Akka Mahadevi
quote: I do not call it his sign, I do not call it becoming one with his sign. I do not call it union, I do not call it harmony with union. I do not say something has happened, I do not say nothing has happened. I will not name it You, I will not name it I. Now that the White Jasmine Lord is myself, what use for words at all?

author: Akka Mahadevi
quote: When the body becomes Your mirror, how can it serve? When the mind becomes Your Mind, what is left to remember? Once my life is Your gesture, how can I pray? When all my awareness is Yours, what can there be to know? I became you, Lord, and forgot You.

author: Akka Mahadevi
quote: People, male and female, blush when a cloth covering their shame comes loose. When the lord of lives lives drowned without a face in the world, how can you be modest? When all the world is the eye of the lord, onlooking everywhere, what can you cover and conceal?

author: Akka Mahadevi
quote: You are the forest, you are all the great trees in the forest, you are bird and beast playing in and out of all the trees. O lord white as jasmine, filling and filled by all, why don't you show me your face?

author: Akka Mahadevi
quote: I have fallen in love, O mother, with the Beautiful One, who knows no death, knows no decay and has no form.

author: Akka Mahadevi
quote: I have fallen in love, O mother, with the Beautiful One, who has no middle, has no end, has no parts and has no features.

author: Akka Mahadevi
quote: I have fallen in love, O mother, with the Beautiful One, who knows no birth and knows no fear.

author: Akka Mahadevi
quote: I have fallen in love, O mother, with the Beautiful One, who is without any family, without any country and without any peer; Chennamallikarjuna, the Beautiful, is my husband. Fling into the fire the husbands who are subject to death and decay.

author: Akka Mahadevi
quote: He bartered my heart, looted my flesh, claimed as tribute my pleasure, took over all of me. I'm the woman of love for my lord, white as jasmine.

author: Akka Mahadevi
quote: Like a silkworm weaving her house with love from her marrow, and dying in her body's threads winding tight, round and round, I burn desiring what the heart desires. Cut through, O Lord, my heart's greed, and show me your way out, O Lord white as jasmine.

author: Akka Mahadevi
quote: Breath for fragrance, who needs flowers? With peace, patience, forgiving and self-command, who needs the Ultimate Posture? The whole world become oneself, who needs solitude, O lord white as jasmine.

author: Sri Aurobindo
quote: The Divine Truth is greater than any religion or creed or scripture or idea or philosophy.

author: Sri Aurobindo
quote: All religions have some truth in them, but none has the whole truth; all are created in time and finally decline and perish.

author: Sri Aurobindo
quote: When mind is still, then truth gets her chance to be heard in the purity of the silence.

author: Sri Aurobindo
quote: A thought is an arrow shot at the truth; it can hit a point, but not cover the whole target.

author: Sri Aurobindo
quote: Our human knowledge is a candle burnt on a dim altar to a sun-vast Truth.

author: Sri Aurobindo
quote: There are two allied powers in man; knowledge and wisdom. Knowledge is so much of the truth seen in a distorted medium as the mind arrives at by groping, wisdom what the eye of divine vision sees in the spirit.

author: Sri Aurobindo
quote: True knowledge is not attained by thinking. It is what you are; it is what you become.

author: Sri Aurobindo
quote: What men call knowledge, is the reasoned acceptance of false appearances. Wisdom looks behind the veil and sees.

author: Sri Aurobindo
quote: The supreme state of human love is... the unity of one soul in two bodies.

author: Sri Aurobindo
quote: Love is the keynote, Joy is the music, Knowledge is the performer, the Infinite All is the composer and audience.

author: Sri Aurobindo
quote: The whole world yearns after freedom, yet each creature is in love with his chains; this is the first paradox and inextricable knot of our nature.

author: Sri Aurobindo
quote: One can have a psychic feeling of love for someone, a universal love for all creatures, but one has to give oneself only to the Divine.

author: Sri Aurobindo
quote: The Divine Love, unlike the human, is deep and vast and silent; one must become quiet and wide to be aware of it and reply to it.

author: Sri Aurobindo
quote: Love leads us from the suffering of division into the bliss of perfect union, but without losing that joy of the act of union which is the soul's greatest discovery and for which the life of the cosmos is a long preparation.

author: Sri Aurobindo
quote: Beauty is the special divine Manifestation in the physical as Truth is in the mind, Love in the heart, Power in the vital.

author: Sri Aurobindo
quote: Beauty is the way in which the physical expresses the Divine -- but the principle and law of Beauty is something inward and spiritual and expresses itself through the form.

author: Sri Aurobindo
quote: Beauty is Ananda taking form -- but the form need not be a physical shape. One speaks of a beautiful thought, a beautiful act, a beautiful soul. What we speak of as beauty is Ananda in manifestation; beyond manifestation beauty loses itself in Ananda or, you may say, beauty and Ananda become indistinguishably one.

author: Sri Aurobindo
quote: To find highest beauty is to find God; to reveal, to embody, to create, as we say, highest beauty is to bring out of our souls the living image and power of God.

author: Sri Aurobindo
quote: The highest aim of the aesthetic being is to find the Divine through beauty; the highest Art is that which by an inspired use of significant and interpretative form unseals the door of the spirit.

author: Tukaram
quote: Truth is the only freedom; untruth is bondage, there is no secret like this.

author: Tukaram
quote: The essence of the endless Vedas is this: Seek the shelter of God and repeat His name with all thy heart.

author: Tukaram
quote: Merit consists in doing good to others, sin in doing harm to others. There is no other pair comparable to this.

author: Tukaram
quote: Saintliness is not to be purchased in shops, nor is it to be had for wandering, nor in cupboards, nor in deserts, nor in forests.

author: Tukaram
quote: Words are the only Jewels I possess; Words are the only Clothes that I wear; Words are the only food That sustains my life; Words are the only wealth I distribute among people.

author: Tukaram
quote: A beggar at thy door, pleading I stand; Give me an alms, O God, love from thy loving hand.

author: Tukaram
quote: With love you lead me by the hand and stay with me wherever I go.

author: Tukaram
quote: The path of love is the path of devotion to God.

author: Tukaram
quote: Let others wear fine clothes to please the Lord. I offer only my naked heart.

author: Tukaram
quote: My cart is light now. I have thrown away all but love.

author: Tukaram
quote: The shell of the coconut is hard, but the inside is excellent. In accordance with this, remember, that purity inside is what we aim at. The jackfruit has a thorny rind, but it is sweet within. The sugarcane is hard and black without but it is well flavored and sweet within. Our food owes its flavor to salt. The value of a thing depends on its inner qualities; what do its faults outside matter?

author: Tukaram
quote: Without a worshipper, how can God assume a form and accept service? The one makes the other beautiful, as a gold setting shows off a jewel.

author: Tukaram
quote: Smaller than the smallest mote, All embracing as the heavens, I finally see the world as it is -- All appearance but a dream.

author: B. R. Ambedkar
quote: Reason and judgment are the only means to understand truth.

author: B. R. Ambedkar
quote: Nothing is infallible. Nothing is binding forever. Everything is subject to inquiry and examination.

author: B. R. Ambedkar
quote: Religion must mainly be a matter of principles only. It cannot be a matter of rules. The moment it degenerates into rules, it ceases to be a religion, as it kills responsibility which is an essence of the true religious act.

author: B. R. Ambedkar
quote: Indifferentism is the worst kind of disease that can affect people.

author: B. R. Ambedkar
quote: Freedom of mind is the real freedom. A person whose mind is not free, though he may not be in chains, is a slave, not a free man.

author: B. R. Ambedkar
quote: The relationship between husband and wife should be one of closest friends.

author: B. R. Ambedkar
quote: I like the religion that teaches liberty, equality and fraternity.

author: B. R. Ambedkar
quote: A just society is that society in which ascending sense of reverence and descending sense of contempt is dissolved into the creation of a compassionate society.

author: B. R. Ambedkar
quote: It is disgraceful to live at the cost of one's self-respect. Self-respect is the most vital factor in life. Without it, man is a cipher.

author: B. R. Ambedkar
quote: Learn to live in this world with self-respect.

author: B. R. Ambedkar
quote: Man is mortal. Everyone has to die some day or the other. But one must resolve to lay down one's life in enriching the noble ideals of self-respect and in bettering one's human life.

author: Faiz Ahmed Faiz
quote: Speak, for your lips are free; / Speak, your tongue is still your own; / This straight body still is yours, / Speak, your life is still your own.

author: Faiz Ahmed Faiz
quote: We shall see / Certainly we, too, will see / That promised day-- / That day ordained / When these colossal mountains / Of tyranny and oppression / Will explode into wisps of hay.

author: Faiz Ahmed Faiz
quote: This trembling light, this night-bitten dawn, / This is not the dawn we waited for so long. / This is not the dawn whose birth was sired, / By so many lives, by so much blood.

author: Faiz Ahmed Faiz
quote: I bow to your streets, O my country, where / common law decrees none may raise their head. / Should one desire the grace of pilgrimage, / avoid the gaze of others, keep life and limb safe.

author: Faiz Ahmed Faiz
quote: Do not ask, my love, for the love we had before: / You existed, I told myself, so all existence shone, / Grief for me was you; the world's grief was far. / Spring was ever renewed in your face: / Beyond your eyes, what could the world hold? / Had I won you, Fate's head would hang, defeated.

author: Faiz Ahmed Faiz
quote: Before you came, / things were as they should be: / the sky was the dead-end of sight, / the road was just a road, wine merely wine. / Now everything is like my heart, / a color at the edge of blood: / the grey of your absence, the color of poison, of thorns, / the gold when we meet, the season ablaze, / the yellow of autumn, the red of flowers, of flames, / and the black when you cover the earth / with the coal of dead fires.

author: Faiz Ahmed Faiz
quote: My beloved, / My own, / Do not demand the love / I gave you once. / For a moment, I really believed / That you alone gave meaning / To my withered life; / That the accelerating pain / Of my unrequited love, / Would make me forget / All other torments / Of this troubled world; / That your face lent stability / To the restless spring; / That nothing else mattered / In this empty world / But your deep, seductive eyes.

author: Faiz Ahmed Faiz
quote: Your beauty guaranteed the spring, ordained its enduring green. Your eyes were all there was of value anywhere.

author: Faiz Ahmed Faiz
quote: Before you came things were just what they were: the road precisely a road, the horizon fixed, the limit of what could be seen, a glass of wine no more than a glass of wine.

author: Faiz Ahmed Faiz
quote: The world knows sorrows other than those of love, pleasures beyond those of romance: The dread dark spell of countless centuries woven with silk and satin and gold brocade.

author: Faiz Ahmed Faiz
quote: Your beauty is alluring as ever, your arms inviting as always: But how can I ever ignore all this ugliness, all this pain?

author: Parveen Shakir
quote: Main sach kahungi magar phir bhi haar jaungi, Woh jhooth bolega aur la-jawab kar dega.

author: Parveen Shakir
quote: Khush aaye tujhe shahr-e-munaafiq ki ameeri, Hum logon ko sach kehne ki aadat bhi bahut thi.

author: Parveen Shakir
quote: Woh bhi sar-e-maqtal hai ki sach jis ka tha shaahid, Aur waaqif-e-ahvaal-e-adaalat bhi bahut thi.

author: Parveen Shakir
quote: He is fragrance, and shall diffuse in the winds, / The trouble lies with the flower, where shall the flower go?

author: Parveen Shakir
quote: I thought it's just a wound that would heal at last, / Little did I know it would spread out to every part of my existence.

author: Parveen Shakir
quote: My heart refuses to go down the path / That tries to separate you from me.

author: Parveen Shakir
quote: My quivering lips continue to utter just this prayer / That the time stops, that these moments freeze forever.

author: Parveen Shakir
quote: Fatigued by travel, you have halted to respite in the desert / What do you care if someone is left all alone to continue this journey?

author: Parveen Shakir
quote: Whenever you change, my eyes unwittingly / Wander over my fate in the pattern of my palms.

author: Parveen Shakir
quote: I wish for you a well-pleased life, a contented heart, / And a hope that you never have to suffer the agony of loneliness.

author: Parveen Shakir
quote: No one will love you the way I did, / So do not fall in love again ever!

author: Parveen Shakir
quote: A whole lifetime is required to know full well what beauty is, for girls do not reveal themselves in momentary encounters.

author: Parveen Shakir
quote: He is the fragrance that will disperse in the wind. Now the question is what will become of the flower.

author: Parveen Shakir
quote: Call him a cloud or a star or a breeze. He seemed elusive in the substance of her being.

author: Parveen Shakir
quote: In the icy arms of marble, faced with this dreamy beauty, my eyes are in a daze.

author: Dalai Lama XIV (Tenzin Gyatso)
quote: Try to remain truthful. The power of truth never declines. Force and violence may be effective in the short term, but in the long run it's truth that prevails.

author: Dalai Lama XIV (Tenzin Gyatso)
quote: We must not lose our trust in the power of truth. Everything is always changing in the world.

author: Dalai Lama XIV (Tenzin Gyatso)
quote: If you are honest, truthful, and transparent, people trust you. If people trust you, you have no grounds for fear, suspicion or jealousy.

author: Dalai Lama XIV (Tenzin Gyatso)
quote: The challenge today is to convince people of the value of truth, honesty, compassion and a concern for others.

author: Dalai Lama XIV (Tenzin Gyatso)
quote: From the viewpoint of absolute truth, what we feel and experience in our ordinary daily life is all delusion.

author: Dalai Lama XIV (Tenzin Gyatso)
quote: Love is the absence of judgment.

author: Dalai Lama XIV (Tenzin Gyatso)
quote: Love and compassion are necessities, not luxuries. Without them, humanity cannot survive.

author: Dalai Lama XIV (Tenzin Gyatso)
quote: Remember that the best relationship is one in which your love for each other exceeds your need for each other.

author: Dalai Lama XIV (Tenzin Gyatso)
quote: The need for love lies at the very foundation of human existence.

author: Dalai Lama XIV (Tenzin Gyatso)
quote: Give the ones you love wings to fly, roots to come back, and reasons to stay.

author: Dalai Lama XIV (Tenzin Gyatso)
quote: The more you are motivated by love, the more fearless and free your action will be.

author: Dalai Lama XIV (Tenzin Gyatso)
quote: If there is love, there is hope that one may have real families, real brotherhood, real equanimity, real peace.

author: Dalai Lama XIV (Tenzin Gyatso)
quote: Love and compassion are the pillars of world peace.

author: Dalai Lama XIV (Tenzin Gyatso)
quote: People go to great lengths to look physically attractive, but inner beauty is a more important and stronger basis for lasting relationships.

author: Dalai Lama XIV (Tenzin Gyatso)
quote: I often tease young people about their concern for how they look; more important is inner beauty--compassion, affection, and respect.

author: Dalai Lama XIV (Tenzin Gyatso)
quote: Real human beauty is expressed through warmheartedness.

author: Dalai Lama XIV (Tenzin Gyatso)
quote: With genuine love and compassion, another person's appearance or behavior has no effect on your attitude.

author: Dalai Lama XIV (Tenzin Gyatso)
quote: Some people, sweet and attractive, and strong and healthy, happen to die young. They are masters in disguise teaching us about impermanence.

author: Pema Chödrön
quote: Fear is a natural reaction to moving closer to the truth.

author: Pema Chödrön
quote: The truth you believe and cling to makes you unavailable to hear anything new.

author: Pema Chödrön
quote: In truth, there is enormous space in which to live our everyday lives.

author: Pema Chödrön
quote: We think that the point is to pass the test or overcome the problem, but the truth is that things don't really get solved. They come together and they fall apart.

author: Pema Chödrön
quote: The most fundamental aggression to ourselves, the most fundamental harm we can do to ourselves, is to remain ignorant by not having the courage and the respect to look at ourselves honestly and gently.

author: Pema Chödrön
quote: If we learn to open our hearts, anyone, including the people who drive us crazy, can be our teacher.

author: Pema Chödrön
quote: Compassion is not a relationship between the healer and the wounded. It's a relationship between equals. Only when we know our own darkness well can we be present with the darkness of others. Compassion becomes real when we recognize our shared humanity.

author: Pema Chödrön
quote: The only reason we don't open our hearts and minds to other people is that they trigger confusion in us that we don't feel brave enough or sane enough to deal with.

author: Pema Chödrön
quote: Having compassion starts and ends with having compassion for all those unwanted parts of ourselves, all those imperfections that we don't even want to look at.

author: Pema Chödrön
quote: Without loving-kindness for ourselves, it is difficult to genuinely feel it for others.

author: Pema Chödrön
quote: Someone I loved once gave me a box full of darkness. It took me years to understand that this, too, was a gift.

author: Pema Chödrön
quote: Whatever our quality is, that's our wealth and our beauty; that's what other people respond to.

author: Pema Chödrön
quote: We see how beautiful and wonderful and amazing things are, and we see how caught up we are. It isn't that one is the bad part and one is the good part, but that it's a kind of interesting, smelly, rich, fertile mess of stuff. When it's all mixed up together, it's us: humanness.

author: Pema Chödrön
quote: That nothing is static or fixed, that all is fleeting and impermanent, is the first mark of existence.

author: Pema Chödrön
quote: One can appreciate and celebrate each moment -- there's nothing more sacred. There's nothing more vast or absolute. In fact, there's nothing more!

author: Pema Chödrön
quote: Each moment is just what it is. It might be the only moment of our life; it might be the only strawberry we'll ever eat. We could get depressed about it, or we could finally appreciate it and delight in the preciousness of every single moment of our life.

author: Teresa of Ávila
quote: Truth suffers, but never dies.

author: Teresa of Ávila
quote: It is a most certain truth, that the richer we see ourselves to be, confessing at the same time our poverty, the greater will be our progress, and the more real our humility.

author: Teresa of Ávila
quote: To be humble is to walk in truth.

author: Teresa of Ávila
quote: Never affirm anything unless you are sure it is true.

author: Teresa of Ávila
quote: Prayer is an act of love; words are not needed. Even if sickness distracts from thoughts, all that is needed is the will to love.

author: Teresa of Ávila
quote: It is not a matter of thinking a great deal but of loving a great deal, so do whatever arouses you most to love.

author: Teresa of Ávila
quote: Love draws forth love.

author: Teresa of Ávila
quote: Accustom yourself continually to make many acts of love, for they enkindle and melt the soul.

author: Teresa of Ávila
quote: True love grows by sacrifice and the more thoroughly the soul rejects natural satisfaction the stronger and more detached its tenderness becomes.

author: Teresa of Ávila
quote: Love makes labour light. Love alone gives value to all things.

author: Teresa of Ávila
quote: So dearly does His Majesty love us that He will reward our love for our neighbor by increasing the love which we bear to Himself, and that in a thousand ways.

author: Teresa of Ávila
quote: It is not so essential to think much as to love much.

author: Teresa of Ávila
quote: It is the nature of love to work in a thousand different ways.

author: Teresa of Ávila
quote: Nothing can be compared to the great beauty and capabilities of a soul; however keen our intellects may be, they are as unable to comprehend them as to comprehend God, for, as He has told us, He created us in His own image and likeness.

author: Teresa of Ávila
quote: As to what good qualities there may be in our souls, or who dwells within them, or how precious they are -- those are things which we seldom consider and so we trouble little about carefully preserving the soul's beauty.

author: Teresa of Ávila
quote: In a state of grace, the soul is like a well of limpid water, from which flow only streams of clearest crystal. Its works are pleasing both to God and man, rising from the River of Life, beside which it is rooted like a tree.

author: Teresa of Ávila
quote: We may speak of love and humility as the true flowers of spiritual growth; and they give off a wonderful scent, which benefits all those who come near.

author: St. Francis of Assisi
quote: Where there is error, may we bring truth.

author: St. Francis of Assisi
quote: Truth needs not to be proved; it is its own witness.

author: St. Francis of Assisi
quote: We must all be on our guard against pride and empty boasting and beware of worldly or natural wisdom. A worldly spirit loves to talk a lot but do nothing, striving for the exterior signs of holiness that people can see, with no desire for true piety and interior holiness of spirit.

author: St. Francis of Assisi
quote: Humility, patience, perfect simplicity, and true peace of heart are all its aim, but above everything else it desires the fear of God, the divine wisdom and the divine love of the Father, Son, and Holy Spirit.

author: St. Francis of Assisi
quote: When we see or hear people speaking or doing evil or blaspheming God, we must say and do good, praising God, who is blessed forever.

author: St. Francis of Assisi
quote: Lord, make me an instrument of thy peace. Where there is hatred, let me sow love.

author: St. Francis of Assisi
quote: Lord, grant that I might not so much seek to be loved as to love.

author: St. Francis of Assisi
quote: For it is in giving that we receive.

author: St. Francis of Assisi
quote: Where there is charity and wisdom, there is neither fear nor ignorance.

author: St. Francis of Assisi
quote: Blessed is the servant who loves his brother as much when he is sick and useless as when he is well and can be of service to him.

author: St. Francis of Assisi
quote: Dear God, please reveal to us your sublime beauty, that is everywhere, everywhere, everywhere, so that we will never again feel frightened.

author: St. Francis of Assisi
quote: A single sunbeam is enough to drive away many shadows.

author: St. Francis of Assisi
quote: All the darkness in the world cannot extinguish the light of a single candle.

author: St. Francis of Assisi
quote: Be praised, my Lord, through all your creatures, especially through my lord Brother Sun, who brings the day; and you give light through him. And he is beautiful and radiant in all his splendor! Of you, Most High, he bears the likeness.

author: St. Francis of Assisi
quote: Be praised, my Lord, through Sister Moon and the stars; in the heavens you have made them, precious and beautiful.

author: St. Francis of Assisi
quote: Be praised, my Lord, through our sister Mother Earth, who feeds us and rules us, and produces various fruits with colored flowers and herbs.

author: Meister Eckhart
quote: I tell you the truth, any object you have in your mind, however good, will be a barrier between you and the inmost Truth.

author: Meister Eckhart
quote: Truth is something so noble that if God could turn aside from it, I could keep the truth and let God go.

author: Meister Eckhart
quote: Only the hand that erases can write the true thing.

author: Meister Eckhart
quote: The eye through which I see God is the same eye through which God sees me; my eye and God's eye are one eye, one seeing, one knowing, one love.

author: Meister Eckhart
quote: All true morality, inward and outward, is comprehended in love, for love is the foundation of all the commandments.

author: Meister Eckhart
quote: As God can only be seen by His own light, so He can only be loved by His own love.

author: Meister Eckhart
quote: If you love yourself, you love everybody else as you do yourself. As long as you love another person less than yourself, you will not succeed in loving yourself, but if you love all alike, including yourself, you will love them as one person and that person is both God and man.

author: Meister Eckhart
quote: Love is as strong as death, as hard as Hell. Death separates the soul from the body, but love separates all things from the soul.

author: Meister Eckhart
quote: What a man takes in by contemplation, that he pours out in love.

author: Meister Eckhart
quote: This then is salvation - when we marvel at the beauty of created things and praise their beautiful Creator.

author: Meister Eckhart
quote: Grace pours all beauty into the soul ... The soul means the world.

author: Meister Eckhart
quote: Apprehend God in all things, for God is in all things. Every single creature is full of God and is a book about God. Every creature is a word of God.

author: Julian of Norwich
quote: Truth sees God, and wisdom contemplates God, and from these two comes a third, a holy and wonderful delight in God, who is love.

author: Julian of Norwich
quote: Where Truth and Wisdom are verily, there is Love verily, coming of them both.

author: Julian of Norwich
quote: God is endless, sovereign Truth,--Wisdom,--Love, not-made; and man's Soul is a creature in God which hath the same properties made.

author: Julian of Norwich
quote: Our life is all grounded and rooted in love, and without love we may not live.

author: Julian of Norwich
quote: He that made all things for love, by the same love keepeth them, and shall keep them without end.

author: Julian of Norwich
quote: Wouldest thou wit thy Lord's meaning in this thing? Wit it well: Love was his meaning. Who shewed it thee? Love. What shewed He thee? Love. Wherefore shewed it He? for Love...Thus was I learned that Love is our Lord's meaning.

author: Julian of Norwich
quote: God loved us before he made us; and his love has never diminished and never shall.

author: Julian of Norwich
quote: The greatest honor we can give Almighty God is to live gladly because of the knowledge of his love.

author: Julian of Norwich
quote: In life is marvellous homeliness, and in love is gentle courtesy, and in light is endless Nature-hood.

author: Julian of Norwich
quote: For Nature is all good and fair in itself, and Grace was sent out to save Nature and destroy sin, and bring again fair nature to the blessed point from whence it came: that is God.

author: Julian of Norwich
quote: And thus an horrible thing to see for the loved soul that would be all fair and shining in the sight of God, as Nature and Grace teacheth.

author: Julian of Norwich
quote: The soul that beholdeth the fair nature of our Lord Jesus, it hateth no hell but sin.

author: Hildegard of Bingen
quote: The truth is like a tree that has deep roots and high branches.

author: Hildegard of Bingen
quote: Truthfulness is like a mirror that shows us who we really are and what we need to do in life.

author: Hildegard of Bingen
quote: Honesty is like a light that dispels darkness and reveals the truth.

author: Hildegard of Bingen
quote: What I do not see I do not know. I see, hear and know simultaneously and learn what I know as if in a moment.

author: Hildegard of Bingen
quote: Just as a mirror, which reflects all things, is set in its own container, so too the rational soul is placed in the fragile container of the body. In this way, the body is governed in its earthly life by the soul, and the soul contemplates heavenly things through faith.

author: Hildegard of Bingen
quote: Love abounds in all things, excels from the depths to beyond the stars, is lovingly disposed to all things. She has given the king on high the kiss of peace.

author: Hildegard of Bingen
quote: The soul is kissed by God in its innermost regions. With interior yearning, grace and blessing are bestowed. It is a yearning to take on God's gentle yoke, It is a yearning to give one's self to God's Way.

author: Hildegard of Bingen
quote: We shall awaken from our dullness and rise vigorously toward justice. If we fall in love with creation deeper and deeper, we will respond to its endangerment with passion.

author: Hildegard of Bingen
quote: Love, which, in concert with Abstinence, established Faith, and which, along with Patience, builds up Chastity, is like the columns that sustain the four corners of a house.

author: Hildegard of Bingen
quote: It is the love of God that flows through all creation... Humanity is called to participate in this love by caring for the earth and all its creatures.

author: Hildegard of Bingen
quote: She is so bright and glorious that you cannot look at her face or her garments for the splendor with which she shines. For she is terrible with the terror of the avenging lightning, and gentle with the goodness of the bright sun; and both her terror and her gentleness are incomprehensible to humans... But she is with everyone and in everyone, and so beautiful is her secret that no person can know the sweetness with which she sustains people, and spares them in inscrutable mercy.

author: Hildegard of Bingen
quote: I am the fiery life of the essence of God; I am the flame above the beauty in the fields; I shine in the waters; I burn in the sun, the moon, and the stars. And with the airy wind, I quicken all things vitally by an unseen, all-sustaining life.

author: Hildegard of Bingen
quote: Glance at the sun. See the moon and the stars. Gaze at the beauty of the Earth's greenings. Now, think.

author: Hildegard of Bingen
quote: Every creature is a glittering, glistening mirror of Divinity.

author: Hildegard of Bingen
quote: Humanity, take a good look at yourself. Inside, you've got heaven and earth, and all of creation. You're a world--everything is hidden in you.

author: Mother Teresa
quote: The truth is nothing but humility, and when we are humble, we are holy.

author: Mother Teresa
quote: Humility is truth, therefore in all sincerity we must be able to look up and say, 'I can do all things in Him who strengthens me.' By yourself you can do nothing, have nothing but sin, weakness and misery. All the gifts of nature and grace you have them from God.

author: Mother Teresa
quote: Honesty and transparency make you vulnerable. Be honest and transparent anyway.

author: Mother Teresa
quote: If you judge people, you have no time to love them.

author: Mother Teresa
quote: Not all of us can do great things. But we can do small things with great love.

author: Mother Teresa
quote: Every time you smile at someone, it is an action of love, a gift to that person, a beautiful thing.

author: Mother Teresa
quote: Love begins at home, and it is not how much we do... but how much love we put in that action.

author: Mother Teresa
quote: Spread love everywhere you go. Let no one ever come to you without leaving happier.

author: Mother Teresa
quote: Intense love does not measure, it just gives.

author: Mother Teresa
quote: The hunger for love is much more difficult to remove than the hunger for bread.

author: Mother Teresa
quote: I have found the paradox, that if you love until it hurts, there can be no more hurt, only more love.

author: Mother Teresa
quote: Love is a fruit in season at all times, and within reach of every hand.

author: Mother Teresa
quote: Do not think that love, in order to be genuine, has to be extraordinary.

author: Mother Teresa
quote: Life is beauty, admire it.

author: Mother Teresa
quote: Do you want to do something beautiful for God? There is a person who needs you. This is your chance.

author: Mother Teresa
quote: Let us always meet each other with a smile, for the smile is the beginning of love.

author: Mother Teresa
quote: Purity, chastity, and virginity created a special beauty in Mary that attracted God's attention.

author: Virginia Woolf
quote: If you do not tell the truth about yourself you cannot tell it about other people.

author: Virginia Woolf
quote: For there is a virtue in truth; it has an almost mystic power. Like radium, it seems to give off forever and ever grains of energy, atoms of light.

author: Virginia Woolf
quote: It is in our idleness, in our dreams, that the submerged truth sometimes comes to the top.

author: Virginia Woolf
quote: Mental fight means thinking against the current, not with it. It is our business to puncture gas bags and discover the seeds of truth.

author: Virginia Woolf
quote: Truth is only to be had by laying together many varieties of error.

author: Virginia Woolf
quote: One cannot think well, love well, sleep well, if one has not dined well.

author: Virginia Woolf
quote: I see you everywhere, in the stars, in the river, to me you're everything that exists; the reality of everything.

author: Virginia Woolf
quote: Just in case you ever foolishly forget; I'm never not thinking of you.

author: Virginia Woolf
quote: Love, the poet said, is woman's whole existence.

author: Virginia Woolf
quote: To love makes one solitary.

author: Virginia Woolf
quote: What does the brain matter compared with the heart?

author: Virginia Woolf
quote: But nothing is so strange when one is in love (and what was this except being in love?) as the complete indifference of other people.

author: Virginia Woolf
quote: There was a star riding through clouds one night, and I said to the star 'Consume me'.

author: Virginia Woolf
quote: Beauty was not everything. Beauty had this penalty--it came too readily, came too completely. It stilled life--froze it.

author: Virginia Woolf
quote: Beauty, the world seemed to say. And as if to prove it (scientifically) wherever he looked... beauty sprang instantly... Beauty was everywhere.

author: Virginia Woolf
quote: No sooner have you feasted on beauty with your eyes than your mind tells you that beauty is vain and beauty passes.

author: Virginia Woolf
quote: As for the beauty of women, it is like the light on the sea, never constant to a single wave. They all have it; they all lose it.

author: Virginia Woolf
quote: The inner life has its soft and gentle beauty; an abstract formlessness as well as a subtle charm.

author: Virginia Woolf
quote: The beautiful seems right by force of beauty, and the feeble wrong because of weakness.

author: Allen Ginsberg
quote: I don't think there is any truth. There are only points of view.

author: Allen Ginsberg
quote: Truth is dissent, where all power resides in the Big Lie.

author: Allen Ginsberg
quote: The only thing that can save the world is the reclaiming of the awareness of the world. That's what poetry does. By poetry I mean the imagining of what has been lost and what can be found--the imagining of who we are and the slow realization of it.

author: Allen Ginsberg
quote: Poetry is the one place where people can speak their original human mind. It is the outlet for people to say in public what is known in private.

author: Allen Ginsberg
quote: The weight of the world is love. Under the burden of solitude, under the burden of dissatisfaction.

author: Allen Ginsberg
quote: No rest without love, no sleep without dreams of love--be mad or chill obsessed with angels or machines, the final wish is love--cannot be bitter, cannot deny, cannot withhold if denied: the weight is too heavy.

author: Allen Ginsberg
quote: I speak of love that comes to mind: the moon is faithful...

author: Allen Ginsberg
quote: Be careful, you are not in Wonderland. I've heard the strange madness long growing in your soul. But you are fortunate in your ignorance, in your isolation. You who have suffered, find where love hides. Give, share, lose--lest we die, unbloomed.

author: Allen Ginsberg
quote: I shudder, I see the love, I'm doomed, my heart melts again--can't stand not to be in love, can't stand not to be melting with real tenderness, childlike need sweetnesses, that's what's wrong with me.

author: Allen Ginsberg
quote: We're all golden sunflowers inside.

author: Allen Ginsberg
quote: None of us understand what we're doing, but we do beautiful things anyway.

author: Allen Ginsberg
quote: Follow your inner moonlight; don't hide the madness.

author: Allen Ginsberg
quote: When you notice something clearly and see it vividly, it then becomes sacred.

author: Allen Ginsberg
quote: The poignancy of a photograph comes from looking back to a fleeting moment in a floating world. The transitoriness is what creates the sense of the sacred.

author: Adrienne Rich
quote: When a woman tells the truth she is creating the possibility for more truth around her.

author: Adrienne Rich
quote: The unconscious wants truth. It ceases to speak to those who want something else more than truth.

author: Adrienne Rich
quote: False history gets made all day, any day, the truth of the new is never on the news.

author: Adrienne Rich
quote: Lying is done with words and also with silence.

author: Adrienne Rich
quote: There is no 'the truth,' 'a truth'--truth is not one thing, or even a system. It is an increasing complexity.

author: Adrienne Rich
quote: I choose to love this time for once with all my intelligence. -- *The Dream of a Common Language: Poems 1974-1977*

author: Adrienne Rich
quote: I do not give simplehearted love and nor allow you simply love me. -- *Tonight No Poetry Will Serve*

author: Adrienne Rich
quote: An honorable human relationship--that is, one in which two people have the right to use the word 'love'--is a process, delicate, violent, often terrifying to both persons involved, a process of refining the truths they can tell each other. -- *On Lies, Secrets, and Silence: Selected Prose 1966-1978*

author: Adrienne Rich
quote: The more I live the more I think two people together is a miracle. -- *Twenty-One Love Poems*

author: Adrienne Rich
quote: I touch you knowing we weren't born tomorrow, and somehow, each of us will help the other live, and somewhere, each of us must help the other die. -- *Twenty-One Love Poems*

author: Adrienne Rich
quote: The beauty of darkness is how it lets you see.

author: Adrienne Rich
quote: We may feel bitterly how little our poems can do in the face of seemingly out-of-control technological power and seemingly limitless corporate greed, yet it has always been true that poetry can break isolation, show us to ourselves when we are outlawed or made invisible, remind us of beauty where no beauty seems possible, remind us of kinship where all is represented as separation.

author: Adrienne Rich
quote: You have to be free to play around with the notion that day might be night, love might be hate; nothing can be too sacred for the imagination to turn into opposite or to call experimentally by another name. For writing is renaming.

author: Octavio Paz
quote: Poetry is not truth, it is the resurrection of presences.

author: Octavio Paz
quote: The relations between rhetoric and ethics are disturbing: the ease with which language can be twisted is worrisome, and the fact that our minds accept these perverse games so docilely is no less cause for concern.

author: Octavio Paz
quote: Modern man likes to pretend that his thinking is wide-awake. But this wide-awake thinking has led us into the mazes of a nightmare in which the torture chambers are endlessly repeated in the mirrors of reason.

author: Octavio Paz
quote: Wisdom lies neither in fixity nor in change, but in the dialectic between the two.

author: Octavio Paz
quote: Love is an attempt to penetrate another being, but it can only be realized if the surrender is mutual.

author: Octavio Paz
quote: It is always difficult to give oneself up; few persons anywhere ever succeed in doing so, and even fewer transcend the possessive stage to know love for what it actually is: a perpetual discovery, and immersion in the waters of reality, an unending re-creation.

author: Octavio Paz
quote: To love is to undress our names.

author: Octavio Paz
quote: Love is the revelation of the other person's freedom.

author: Octavio Paz
quote: Love is not a desire for beauty; it is a yearning for completion.

author: Octavio Paz
quote: A flower without a stem, is beauty waiting to die. A heart without love, is a tear waiting to cry.

author: Octavio Paz
quote: A glass pitcher, a wicker basket, a tunic of coarse cloth. Their beauty is inseparable from their function. Handicrafts belong to a world existing before the separation of the useful and the beautiful.

author: Octavio Paz
quote: This poem is dedicated to those women/Whose beauty is in their charm,/In their intelligence,/In their character,/Not on their fabricated looks.

author: Clarice Lispector
quote: Truth is always an interior and inexplicable contact. My truest life is unrecognizable, extremely interior and there is not a single word that defines it.

author: Clarice Lispector
quote: For only when I err do I get away from what I know and what I understand. If 'truth' were what I can understand, it would end up being but a small truth, my-sized. Truth must reside precisely in what I shall never understand.

author: Clarice Lispector
quote: The only truth is that I live. Sincerely, I live. Who am I? Well, that's a bit much.

author: Clarice Lispector
quote: I do not know much. But there are certain advantages in not knowing. Like virgin territory, the mind is free of preconceptions. Everything I do not know forms the greater part of me: This is my largesse. And with this I understand everything. The things I do not know constitute my truth.

author: Clarice Lispector
quote: Love is now, is always. All that is missing is the coup de grâce--which is called passion.

author: Clarice Lispector
quote: Perhaps love is to give one's own solitude to others? For it is the very last thing we have to offer.

author: Clarice Lispector
quote: It is because I dove into the abyss that I am beginning to love the abyss I am made of.

author: Clarice Lispector
quote: Reality prior to my language exists as an unthinkable thought... life precedes love, bodily matter precedes the body, and one day in its turn language shall have preceded possession of silence.

author: Clarice Lispector
quote: Love is so much more deadly than I had thought, love is so much inherent as the very lack, and we are guaranteed by a need to be renewed continuously. Love is now, is forever. There is just the blow of grace--call it passion.

author: Clarice Lispector
quote: Here is a moment of extravagant beauty: I drink it liquid from the shells of my hands and almost all of it runs sparkling through my fingers: but beauty is like that, it is a fraction of a second, quickness of a flash and then immediately it escapes.

author: Clarice Lispector
quote: When I suddenly see myself in the depths of the mirror, I take fright. I can scarcely believe that I have limits, that I am outlined and defined. I feel myself to be dispersed in the atmosphere, thinking inside other creatures, living inside things beyond myself. When I suddenly see myself in the mirror, I am not startled because I find myself ugly or beautiful. I discover, in fact, that I possess another quality.

author: Clarice Lispector
quote: I don't want beauty, I want identity.

author: Clarice Lispector
quote: In the world there exists no aesthetic plane, not even the aesthetic plane of goodness.

author: Jorge Luis Borges
quote: The truth is that we live out our lives putting off all that can be put off; perhaps we all know deep down that we are immortal and that sooner or later all men will do and know all things.

author: Jorge Luis Borges
quote: Historical truth, for him, is not what has happened; it is what we judge to have happened.

author: Jorge Luis Borges
quote: Reality is not always probable, or likely.

author: Jorge Luis Borges
quote: Scattered through the ordinary world, there are books and artifacts and perhaps people who are like doorways into impossible realms, of impossible and contradictory truth.

author: Jorge Luis Borges
quote: The metaphysicians of Tlön do not seek for the truth or even for verisimilitude, but rather for the astounding.

author: Jorge Luis Borges
quote: To fall in love is to create a religion that has a fallible god.

author: Jorge Luis Borges
quote: Being with you and not being with you is the only way I have to measure time.

author: Jorge Luis Borges
quote: One is in love when one realizes that the other person is unique.

author: Jorge Luis Borges
quote: There are those who seek the love of a woman to forget her, to not think about her.

author: Jorge Luis Borges
quote: I think of reading a book as no less an experience than travelling or falling in love.

author: Jorge Luis Borges
quote: For me, beauty is a physical sensation, something we feel with our whole body. It is not the result of judgement. We do not arrive at it by way of rules. We either feel beauty or we don't.

author: Jorge Luis Borges
quote: In this world, beauty is so common.

author: Jorge Luis Borges
quote: The aesthetic event is something as evident, as immediate, as indefinable as love, the taste of fruit, of water.

author: Gabriel García Márquez
quote: A lie is more comfortable than doubt, more useful than love, more lasting than truth.

author: Gabriel García Márquez
quote: The truth is that the first changes are so slow they pass almost unnoticed, and you go on seeing yourself as you always were, from the inside, but others observe you from the outside.

author: Gabriel García Márquez
quote: The truth is that she spoke about her misfortune without any shame in order to cover up the other misfortune, the real one, that was burning in her insides.

author: Gabriel García Márquez
quote: One must not believe demons even when they speak the truth.

author: Gabriel García Márquez
quote: The truth was that I could not manage my soul, and I was becoming aware of old age because of my weakness in the face of love.

author: Gabriel García Márquez
quote: The only regret I will have in dying is if it is not for love.

author: Gabriel García Márquez
quote: There is always something left to love.

author: Gabriel García Márquez
quote: She would defend herself, saying that love, no matter what else it might be, was a natural talent. She would say: You are either born knowing how, or you never know.

author: Gabriel García Márquez
quote: Sex is the consolation you have when you can't have love.

author: Gabriel García Márquez
quote: It was inevitable: the scent of bitter almonds always reminded him of the fate of unrequited love.

author: Gabriel García Márquez
quote: She had never imagined that curiosity was one of the many masks of love.

author: Gabriel García Márquez
quote: There is no greater glory than to die for love.

author: Gabriel García Márquez
quote: He is ugly and sad... but he is all love.

author: Gabriel García Márquez
quote: Only God knows how much I love you.

author: Gabriel García Márquez
quote: She knew that he loved her above all else, more than anything in the world, but only for his own sake.

author: Gabriel García Márquez
