quote: To him she seemed so beautiful, so seductive, so different from ordinary people, that he could not understand why no one was as disturbed as he by the clicking of her heels on the paving stones...

author: Gabriel García Márquez
quote: She was beautiful and lithe, with soft skin the color of bread and eyes like green almonds...

author: Gabriel García Márquez
quote: Beauty is everywhere, and it can be found in the simplest things.

author: Gabriel García Márquez
quote: She was lost in her longing to understand.

author: Isabel Allende
quote: How many times have I told you not to believe everything you hear? Seek truth for yourself.

author: Isabel Allende
quote: What is truer than truth? Answer: the story.

author: Isabel Allende
quote: You can tell the deepest truths with the lies of fiction.

author: Isabel Allende
quote: I seek truth and beauty in the transparency of an autumn leaf, in the perfect form of a seashell on the beach, in the curve of a woman's back, in the texture of an ancient tree trunk, but also in the elusive forms of reality.

author: Isabel Allende
quote: Truth is short-lived, watered down by torrents of rain.

author: Isabel Allende
quote: For women, the best aphrodisiacs are words. The G-spot is in the ears. He who looks for it below there is wasting his time.

author: Isabel Allende
quote: Perhaps we are in this world to search for love, find it and lose it, again and again. With each love, we are born anew, and with each love that ends we collect a new wound.

author: Isabel Allende
quote: I am happier when I love than when I am loved. I adore my husband, my son, my grandchildren, my mother, my dog, and frankly, I don't know if they even like me. But who cares? Loving them is my joy.

author: Isabel Allende
quote: How accommodating is love, that forgives everything!

author: Isabel Allende
quote: You can't find someone who doesn't want to be found.

author: Isabel Allende
quote: But beauty is a matter of attitude.

author: Isabel Allende
quote: For the first time in her life, Alba wanted to be beautiful... She stared at herself in the thousand pieces of the mirror... and she finally believed that she was the most beautiful woman in the universe because she was able to see herself with Miguel's eyes.

author: Isabel Allende
quote: Beauty is illusion, madame said; at fifteen all girls are pretty, but to keep being that way requires discipline.

author: Isabel Allende
quote: If you observe an ordinary object or body very closely, it is transformed into something sacred.

author: César Vallejo
quote: At the moment the philosopher discovers a new truth, he is a complete beast.

author: César Vallejo
quote: There exist questions without answers, which fill the spirit of science and common sense with uneasiness. There exist answers without questions, which are the spirit of art and the dialectic consciousness of things.

author: César Vallejo
quote: Justice is not a human function. Nor can it be. Justice operates tacitly, deeper inside than all insides, in the courts and the prisoners.

author: César Vallejo
quote: There are desires to return, to love, to not disappear, and there are desires to die, fought by two opposing waters that have never isthmused.

author: César Vallejo
quote: My love, we will die close together, in each other's grips; this bitterness between us will wither and fade and the shadows will marry our lifeless lips.

author: César Vallejo
quote: Love is strong only when it must die! And the tomb will be an enormous eye in whose depths the agony of love lives on, enduring and weeping, as in a cup of sweet eternity and the blackest dawn.

author: César Vallejo
quote: I think about your sex. My heart simplified, I think about your sex, before the ripe daughterloin of day.

author: César Vallejo
quote: Oh, my God, it's only now I come to you-- this late day, when I am full of love and turn to the rigged balance of a pair of breasts to weigh and grieve this frail creation.

author: César Vallejo
quote: The arts (painting, poetry, etc.) are not just these. Eating, drinking, walking are also arts; every act is an art.

author: César Vallejo
quote: Nature creates the eternity of Substance. Art creates the eternity of Form.

author: César Vallejo
quote: Upon a certain mysterious balance between what is visible and invisible in a portrait, between circumstance and permanence, or, what amounts to the same thing, between appearance and character is what the greatness of a creation depends.

author: César Vallejo
quote: Beauty, says Paul Valéry, comes from difficulty. There is no construction possible without rules or a system, that is, without science. Because in man nothing should be blind.

author: Eduardo Galeano
quote: There are those who believe destiny rests at the feet of the gods, but the truth is that it confronts the conscious of man with a burning challenge.

author: Eduardo Galeano
quote: No history is mute. No matter how much they own it, break it, and lie about it, human history refuses to shut its mouth. Despite deafness and ignorance, the time that was continues to tick inside the time that is.

author: Eduardo Galeano
quote: The first to be killed in war is the truth.

author: Eduardo Galeano
quote: Those who make objectivity a religion are liars. They are afraid of human pain. They don't want to be objective, it's a lie: they want to be objects, so as not to suffer.

author: Eduardo Galeano
quote: We are all mortal until the first kiss and the second glass of wine.

author: Eduardo Galeano
quote: Ojalá podamos tener el coraje de estar solos y la valentía de arriesgarnos a estar juntos.

author: Eduardo Galeano
quote: El amor es una enfermedad de las más jodidas y contagiosas.

author: Eduardo Galeano
quote: I can't sleep. There is a woman stuck between my eyelids. I would tell her to get out if I could. But there is a woman stuck in my throat.

author: Eduardo Galeano
quote: Recordar: Del latín re-cordis, volver a pasar por el corazón...

author: Eduardo Galeano
quote: The history of soccer is a sad voyage from beauty to duty. When the sport became an industry, the beauty that blossoms from the joy of play got torn out by its very roots.

author: Eduardo Galeano
quote: I'm attracted to soccer's capacity for beauty. When well played, the game is a dance with a ball.

author: Eduardo Galeano
quote: To win without magic, without surprise or beauty, isn't that worse than losing?

author: Eduardo Galeano
quote: Our effectiveness depends on our capacity to be audacious and astute, clear and appealing. I would hope that we can create a language more fearless and beautiful than that used by conformist writers to greet the twilight.

author: Eduardo Galeano
quote: The human rainbow had been mutilated by machismo, racism, militarism and a lot of other isms, who have been terribly killing our greatness, our possible greatness, our possible beauty.

author: Derek Walcott
quote: The thing that is believed is a reality.

author: Derek Walcott
quote: The truth is that the poems are ecstatic.

author: Derek Walcott
quote: We look and see what we see in a mirror, and we believe it. That's important, the question of belief. The question is: Should we believe what we see in a mirror?

author: Derek Walcott
quote: I look in the mirror. There's me. What's in the mirror is not real. So am I unreal?

author: Derek Walcott
quote: The truest writers are those who see language not as a linguistic process but as a living element.

author: Derek Walcott
quote: You will love again the stranger who was your self. Give wine. Give bread. Give back your heart to itself, to the stranger who has loved you all your life, whom you ignored for another, who knows you by heart.

author: Derek Walcott
quote: The time will come when, with elation, you will greet yourself arriving at your own door, in your own mirror, and each will smile at the other's welcome.

author: Derek Walcott
quote: Break a vase, and the love that reassembles the fragments is stronger than that love which took its symmetry for granted when it was whole.

author: Derek Walcott
quote: Visual surprise is natural in the Caribbean; it comes with the landscape, and faced with its beauty, the sigh of History dissolves.

author: Derek Walcott
quote: Good science and good art are always about a condition of awe. I don't think there is any other function for the poet or the scientist in the human tribe but the astonishment of the soul.

author: Derek Walcott
quote: For every poet it is always morning in the world; history a forgotten, insomniac night. The fate of poetry is to fall in love with the world in spite of history.

author: Aimé Césaire
quote: Poetic knowledge is born in the great silence of scientific knowledge.

author: Aimé Césaire
quote: Scientific truth has for sign coherence and efficiency. Poetic truth has beauty as its sign.

author: Aimé Césaire
quote: Prospero, you are the master of illusion. Lying is your trademark. And you have lied so much to me (lied about the world, lied about me) that you have ended by imposing on me an image of myself.

author: Aimé Césaire
quote: People are surprised, they become indignant. They say: 'How strange! But never mind--it's Nazism, it will pass!' And they wait, and they hope; and they hide the truth from themselves...

author: Aimé Césaire
quote: I have never harboured any illusions about the risks of history... History is always dangerous, the world of history is a risky world; but it is up to us at any given moment to establish and readjust the hierarchy of dangers.

author: Aimé Césaire
quote: I have made a pact with the night, I have felt it softly healing me.

author: Aimé Césaire
quote: Reason, I sacrifice you to the evening breeze.

author: Aimé Césaire
quote: One word from you would be more help to me than anything in the world.

author: Aimé Césaire
quote: And let me die suddenly, to be born again in the revelation of beauty....And the revelation of beauty is the wisdom of the ancestors.

author: Aimé Césaire
quote: No race has the monopoly of beauty, intelligence and strength. All foundation of superiority must be destroyed.

author: Aimé Césaire
quote: Culture is everything. Culture is the way we dress, the way we carry our heads, the way we walk, the way we tie our ties--it is not only the fact of writing books or building houses.

author: Aimé Césaire
quote: It is no use painting the foot of the tree white, the strength of the bark cries out from beneath the paint.

author: Louise Bennett-Coverley
quote: Wat a joyful news, Miss Mattie, I feel like me heart gwine burs Jamaica people colonizin Englan in Reverse

author: Louise Bennett-Coverley
quote: Me glad fi see yuh come back, bwoy, But lawd, yuh let me dung Me shame a yuh so till all a Me proudness drop a grung.

author: Louise Bennett-Coverley
quote: When I was a child, nearly everything about us was bad, yuh know; they would tell yuh seh yuh have bad hair, that black people bad, and that the language yuh talk was bad. And I know that a lot of people I knew were not bad at all - they were nice people and they talked this language.

author: Louise Bennett-Coverley
quote: Sun a shine but tings no bright; Doah pot a bwile, bickle no nuff; River flood but water scarce, yawl Rain a fall but dutty tough.

author: Louise Bennett-Coverley
quote: Me darlin love, me lickle dove, / Me dumplin, me gizada, / Me sweetie Sue, I goes fa you / Like how flies goes fa sugar.

author: Louise Bennett-Coverley
quote: As ah puts me pen to paper / An me pen-nib start fi fly / Me rememberance remember / De fus day yuh ketch me yeye!

author: Louise Bennett-Coverley
quote: Me darlin love, me lickle dove, / Me dumplin, me gizada, / The roses long for sunshine / And rain and cooling dew, / Flies goes fa sugar / And love, I goes fa you.

author: Louise Bennett-Coverley
quote: Dah language weh you proud o', / Weh yuh honour and respeck, / Po' Mass Charlie! You noh know sey / Dat it spring from dialect!

author: Louise Bennett-Coverley
quote: When I was a child nearly everything about us was bad, you know; they would tell yuh seh yuh have bad hair, that black people bad ... and that the language yuh talk was bad. And I know that a lot of the people I knew were not bad at all, they were nice people and they talked this language ...

author: Bob Marley
quote: The truth is, everyone is going to hurt you. You just got to find the ones worth suffering for.

author: Bob Marley
quote: The Truth An Offense But Not A Sin.

author: Bob Marley
quote: Truth is the light, so you never give up the fight.

author: Bob Marley
quote: Tell the children the truth.

author: Bob Marley
quote: If she's amazing, she won't be easy. If she's easy, she won't be amazing. If she's worth it, you won't give up. If you give up, you're not worthy. ... Truth is, everybody is going to hurt you; you just gotta find the ones worth suffering for.

author: Bob Marley
quote: The biggest coward of a man is to awaken the love of a woman without the intention of loving her.

author: Bob Marley
quote: You may not be her first, her last, or her only. She loved before she may love again. But if she loves you now, what else matters?

author: Bob Marley
quote: Love the life you live. Live the life you love.

author: Bob Marley
quote: One love, one heart, let's get together and feel all right.

author: Bob Marley
quote: The most beautiful curve on a woman's body is her smile.

author: Bob Marley
quote: The most beautiful things are not perfect, they are special.

author: Bob Marley
quote: She may not be the most popular or prettiest but if you love her and she makes you smile... what else matters?

author: Bob Marley
quote: The beauty of love. The love of beauty. The greener you are, the wiser you will be.

author: Sylvia Wynter
quote: In order to live in society, we must produce the society in which we live.

author: Sylvia Wynter
quote: We do this unconsciously, allowing us to 'repress the recognition of our collective production of our modes of social reality.'

author: Sylvia Wynter
quote: Our own disciplines... must still continue to function, as all human orders of knowledge have done from our origin on the continent of Africa until today, as a language-capacitated form of life, to ensure that we continue to know our present order of social reality, and rigorously so, in the adaptive 'truth-for' terms needed to conserve our present descriptive statement.

author: Sylvia Wynter
quote: Man 'overrepresents itself as if it were the human itself, and that of securing the well-being, and therefore the full cognitive and behavioural autonomy of the human species itself/ourselves.'

author: Sylvia Wynter
quote: There is no apocalypse that is not also an opportunity to re-script the terms of our reality.

author: Sylvia Wynter
quote: Love is the praxis of humanization.

author: Sylvia Wynter
quote: To love is to recognize the shared vulnerability of our human condition.

author: Sylvia Wynter
quote: In the act of loving, we affirm our collective humanity.

author: Sylvia Wynter
quote: Love disrupts the coloniality of power by fostering genuine human connections.

author: Sylvia Wynter
quote: Through love, we challenge the dehumanizing structures of society.

author: Edwidge Danticat
quote: Even when I think of writing fiction, it's being kind of a liar, a storyteller, a weaver, and there's that sense of how much of this is your life. The story is a way you unravel your life from behind a mask.

author: Edwidge Danticat
quote: Sometimes we mask ourselves to further reveal ourselves, and it's always been connected to me with being a writer: We tell lies to tell a greater truth. The story is a mask; the characters you create are masks.

author: Edwidge Danticat
quote: We need literature because we wouldn't fully know ourselves without it. We need good literature to be fully human.

author: Edwidge Danticat
quote: Love is like the rain. It comes in a drizzle sometimes. Then it starts pouring and if you're not careful it will drown you.

author: Edwidge Danticat
quote: All anyone can hope for is just a tiny bit of love, like a drop in a cup if you can get it, or a waterfall, a flood, if you can get that too.

author: Edwidge Danticat
quote: No one will love you more than you love your pain.

author: Edwidge Danticat
quote: I think there's something really beautiful about embracing who you are and owning and accepting all of you and knowing that everything about you is purposeful.

author: Edwidge Danticat
quote: We must learn to see the beauty in the brokenness.

author: Edwidge Danticat
quote: Our differences are what make us beautiful and strong.

author: Edwidge Danticat
quote: Beauty is a quest for meaning. It's a quest for humanity. You don't write about what you know only, you write about what you want to discover.

author: Edwidge Danticat
quote: For the majority of the people it is a difficult place to live. That's a reality that we can't ignore. But there is also great beauty to it.

author: Louise Erdrich
quote: The only time I see the truth is when I cross my eyes.

author: Louise Erdrich
quote: Whenever he thought he knew the truth it merged into another truth.

author: Louise Erdrich
quote: I have never seen the truth...without crossing my eyes. Life is crazy.

author: Louise Erdrich
quote: But if there was embellishment, it only had to do with the facts.

author: Louise Erdrich
quote: In the quest for truth, we often uncover painful secrets that change everything we thought we knew.

author: Louise Erdrich
quote: You have to love. You have to feel. It is the reason you are here on earth. You are here to risk your heart.

author: Louise Erdrich
quote: Love won't be tampered with, love won't go away. Push it to one side and it creeps to the other.

author: Louise Erdrich
quote: To love another human in all of her splendor and imperfect perfection, it is a magnificent task...tremendous and foolish and human.

author: Louise Erdrich
quote: Old love, middle love, the kind of love that knows itself and knows that nothing lasts, is a desperate shared wildness.

author: Louise Erdrich
quote: We do know that no one gets wise enough to really understand the heart of another, though it is the task of our life to try.

author: Louise Erdrich
quote: Effortless. Easy. The lack of trying is what makes them lovely. We all try too hard. Striving wears down our edges, dulls the best of us.

author: Louise Erdrich
quote: Life will break you. Nobody can protect you from that, and living alone won't either, for solitude will also break you with its yearning. You have to love. You have to feel. It is the reason you are here on earth. You are here to risk your heart.

author: Louise Erdrich
quote: We have these earthly bodies. We don't know what they want. Half the time, we pretend they are under our mental thumb, but that is the illusion of the healthy and the protected.

author: Louise Erdrich
quote: What are dreams but an internal wilderness and what is desire but a wildness of the soul?

author: Leslie Marmon Silko
quote: I will tell you something about stories . . . They aren't just entertainment. Don't be fooled. They are all we have, you see, all we have to fight off illness and death.

author: Leslie Marmon Silko
quote: You don't have anything if you don't have the stories.

author: Leslie Marmon Silko
quote: But as long as you remember what you have seen, then nothing is gone. As long as you remember, it is part of this story we have together.

author: Leslie Marmon Silko
quote: The truth of course was otherwise, but Lecha had never felt she owed anyone the truth, unless it was truth about their own lives, and then they had to pay her to tell them.

author: Leslie Marmon Silko
quote: When someone dies, you don't get over it by forgetting; you get over it by remembering, and you are aware that no person is ever truly lost or gone once they have been in our life and loved us, as we have loved them.

author: Leslie Marmon Silko
quote: Night. Heavenly delicious sweet night of the desert that calls all of us to love her. The night is our comfort with her coolness and darkness. On wings, on feet, on our bellies, out we all come to glory in the night.

author: Leslie Marmon Silko
quote: Relationships. That's all there really is. There's your relationship with the dust that just blew in your face, or with the person who just kicked you end over end... You have to come to terms, to some kind of equilibrium, with those people around you, those people who care for you, your environment.

author: Leslie Marmon Silko
quote: There is a beauty at the heart of everything, because sometimes, the ugly is only an illusion.

author: Leslie Marmon Silko
quote: The desert teaches us to appreciate the smallest moments of beauty.

author: Leslie Marmon Silko
quote: The desert is a canvas where dreams are painted with the colors of hope.

author: Leslie Marmon Silko
quote: The dunes whisper ancient stories that have been carried on the wind for centuries.

author: Leslie Marmon Silko
quote: The power of nature can heal even the deepest wounds of the soul.

author: Zitkala-Sa
quote: There is no great; there is no small; in the mind that causeth all.

author: Zitkala-Sa
quote: Few there are who have paused to question whether real life or long-lasting death lies beneath this semblance of civilization.

author: Zitkala-Sa
quote: I fear no man. Sometimes I think I do not even fear God.

author: Zitkala-Sa
quote: A wee child toddling in a wonder world, I prefer to their dogma my excursions into the natural gardens where the voice of the Great Spirit is heard in the twittering of birds, the rippling of mighty waters, and the sweet breathing of flowers. If this is Paganism, then at present, at least, I am a Pagan.

author: Zitkala-Sa
quote: The sun, the earth, love, friends, our very breath are parts of the banquet.

author: Zitkala-Sa
quote: The nectar of life is sweet only when shared with others.

author: Zitkala-Sa
quote: With the bird songs, I was at home.

author: Zitkala-Sa
quote: My heart and I lie small upon the earth like a grain of throbbing sand.

author: Zitkala-Sa
quote: The voice of the Great Spirit is heard in the twittering of birds, the rippling of mighty waters, and the sweet breathing of flowers.

author: Zitkala-Sa
quote: Their quaint round faces of varied hue convince the heart which leaps with glad surprise that they, too, are living symbols of omnipotent thought. With a child's eager eye I drink in the myriad star shapes wrought in luxuriant color upon the green. Beautiful is the spiritual essence they embody.

author: Zitkala-Sa
quote: My heart and I lie small upon the earth like a grain of throbbing sand. Drifting clouds and tinkling waters, together with the warmth of a genial summer day, bespeak with eloquence the loving Mystery round about us.

author: Billy-Ray Belcourt
quote: Herein lies my poetic truth. Love, then, isn't remotely about what we might lose when it inevitably dissipates.

author: Billy-Ray Belcourt
quote: With joy, we breach the haze of suffering that denies us creativity and literature. Joy is art is an ethics of resistance.

author: Billy-Ray Belcourt
quote: I wrote about the future because I wanted to invent it. I wrote about the present so that it wouldn't obliterate me.

author: Billy-Ray Belcourt
quote: But as a poet, I couldn't break the habit of trying to make the world and thus my lived life into an art object. I said yes to the world again and again, sometimes to my detriment, if only to increase the volume of my selfhood.

author: Billy-Ray Belcourt
quote: Rather than change the world, a novel could index a longing for something else, for a different arrangement of bodies, feelings, and environments in which human flourishing wasn't inhibited for the marginalized, which seemed as urgent an act of rebellion as any.

author: Billy-Ray Belcourt
quote: To love someone is firstly to confess: I'm prepared to be devastated by you.

author: Billy-Ray Belcourt
quote: That's what love is -- someone else's spirit moving through you. When someone moves through you they leave behind a small trace of human life. It's how we know we're still alive.

author: Billy-Ray Belcourt
quote: Love, then, isn't remotely about what we might lose when it inevitably dissipates. How unworkable love would be were we to subject it to a risk-cost benefits analysis!

author: Billy-Ray Belcourt
quote: Love is the clumsy name we give to a body spilling outside itself.

author: Billy-Ray Belcourt
quote: Sometimes not loving is the most radical thing you can do.

author: Billy-Ray Belcourt
quote: What if I'm a beautiful wound people dance inside of?

author: Billy-Ray Belcourt
quote: Joy is art is an ethics of resistance.

author: Billy-Ray Belcourt
quote: If I'm more of a toy to be wound up than a man, can I write beautiful things?

author: Billy-Ray Belcourt
quote: Today, I read and write for beauty, and live so as to disappear.

author: Billy-Ray Belcourt
quote: My body is not a monument of beauty, but a garden of resilience.

author: Ocean Vuong
quote: The truth is we can survive our lives, but not our skin. But you know this already.

author: Ocean Vuong
quote: The truth is none of us are enough, but you know this already. The truth is I came here hoping for a reason to stay.

author: Ocean Vuong
quote: I am writing because they told me to never start a sentence with because. But I wasn't trying to make a sentence--I was trying to break free. Because freedom, I am told, is nothing but the distance between the hunter and its prey.

author: Ocean Vuong
quote: Sometimes you are erased before you are given the choice of stating who you are.

author: Ocean Vuong
quote: Ma. You once told me that memory is a choice. But if you were god, you'd know it's a flood.

author: Ocean Vuong
quote: They say nothing lasts forever but they're just scared it will last longer than they can love it.

author: Ocean Vuong
quote: To love something, then, is to name it after something so worthless it might be left untouched--and alive.

author: Ocean Vuong
quote: To love is to be a witness.

author: Ocean Vuong
quote: Love is a small, trembling thing.

author: Ocean Vuong
quote: To despair is to wish our pain could be loved away.

author: Ocean Vuong
quote: Love is a fire that cannot be seen, but is always felt.

author: Ocean Vuong
quote: Love is the most ancient of all languages.

author: Ocean Vuong
quote: Love is the journey and the destination.

author: Ocean Vuong
quote: I am thinking of beauty again, how some things are hunted because we have deemed them beautiful. If, relative to the history of our planet, an individual life is so short, a blink, as they say, then to be gorgeous, even from the day you're born to the day you die, is to be gorgeous only briefly.

author: Ocean Vuong
quote: Because the sunset, like survival, exists only on the verge of its own disappearing. To be gorgeous, you must first be seen, but to be seen allows you to be hunted.

author: Ocean Vuong
quote: Because the thing about beauty is that it's only beautiful outside of itself. Seen through a mirror, I viewed my body as another, a boy a few feet away, his expression unmoved, daring the skin to remain as it was, as if the sun, setting, was not already elsewhere, was not in Ohio.

author: Ocean Vuong
quote: All this time I told myself we were born from war--but I was wrong, Ma. We were born from beauty. Let no one mistake us for the fruit of violence--but that violence, having passed through the fruit, failed to spoil it.

author: Ta-Nehisi Coates
quote: The entire narrative of this country argues against the truth of who you are.

author: Ta-Nehisi Coates
quote: The Dream is the enemy of all art, courageous thinking, and honest writing.

author: Ta-Nehisi Coates
quote: I was learning the craft of poetry, which really was an intensive version of what my mother had taught me all those years ago--the craft of writing as the art of thinking. Poetry aims for an economy of truth--loose and useless words must be discarded, and I found that these loose and useless words were not separate from loose and useless thoughts.

author: Ta-Nehisi Coates
quote: I began to feel that something more than a national trophy case was needed if I was to be truly free... My history professors thought nothing of telling me that my search for myth was doomed, that the stories I wanted to tell myself could not be matched to truths.

author: Ta-Nehisi Coates
quote: An America that looks away is ignoring not just the sins of the past but the sins of the present and the certain sins of the future.

author: Ta-Nehisi Coates
quote: It was like falling in love - the things that get you are so small, the things that keep you up at night are so particular to you that when you try to explain, the only reward anyone can give you is a dumb polite nod.

author: Ta-Nehisi Coates
quote: I love America the way I love my family - I was born into it. And there's no escape out of it.

author: Ta-Nehisi Coates
quote: I was young and love to me was a fuse that was lit, not a garden that was grown.

author: Ta-Nehisi Coates
quote: What I am telling you is that you do not need to know to love, and it is right that you feel it all in any moment. And it is right that you see it through--that you are amazed, then curious, then belligerent, then heartbroken, then numb. You have the right to all of it.

author: Ta-Nehisi Coates
quote: May you find a love that love you, even in these shackled times.

author: Ta-Nehisi Coates
quote: Black is beautiful--which is to say that the black body is beautiful, that black hair must be guarded against the torture of processing and lye, that black skin must be guarded against bleach, that our noses and mouths must be protected against modern surgery. We are all our beautiful bodies and so must never be prostrate before barbarians, must never submit our original self, our one of one, to defiling and plunder.

author: Ta-Nehisi Coates
quote: We are beautiful people with african imaginations.

author: Ta-Nehisi Coates
quote: There is nothing in the world more beautiful than a struggle.

author: Rachel Carson
quote: The aim of science is to discover and illuminate truth. And that, I take it, is the aim of literature, whether biography or history or fiction. It seems to me, then, that there can be no separate literature of science.

author: Rachel Carson
quote: The winds, the sea, and the moving tides are what they are. If there is wonder and beauty and majesty in them, science will discover these qualities. If they are not there, science cannot create them. If there is poetry in my book about the sea, it is not because I deliberately put it there, but because no one could write truthfully about the sea and leave out the poetry.

author: Rachel Carson
quote: Even in the vast and mysterious reaches of the sea we are brought back to the fundamental truth that nothing lives to itself.

author: Rachel Carson
quote: This notion that 'science' is something that belongs in a separate compartment of its own, apart from everyday life, is one that I should like to challenge. We live in a scientific age; yet we assume that knowledge of science is the prerogative of only a small number of human beings, isolated and priest-like in their laboratories. This is not true. It cannot be true. The materials of science are the materials of life itself. Science is part of the reality of living; it is the what, the how, and the why of everything in our experience.

author: Rachel Carson
quote: Once the emotions have been aroused--a sense of the beautiful, the excitement of the new and the unknown, a feeling of sympathy, pity, admiration or love--then we wish for knowledge about the subject of our emotional response.

author: Rachel Carson
quote: Those who love and free nature are never alone.

author: Rachel Carson
quote: I sincerely believe that for the child, and for the parent seeking to guide him, it is not half so important to know as to feel.

author: Rachel Carson
quote: Those who contemplate the beauty of the earth find reserves of strength that will endure as long as life lasts.

author: Rachel Carson
quote: It is a wholesome and necessary thing for us to turn again to the earth and in the contemplation of her beauties to know the sense of wonder and humility.

author: Rachel Carson
quote: Drink in the beauty and wonder at the meaning of what you see.

author: Rachel Carson
quote: One way to open your eyes to unnoticed beauty is to ask yourself: What if I had never seen this before? What if I knew I would never see it again?

author: Rachel Carson
quote: I believe natural beauty has a necessary place in the spiritual development of any individual or any society.

author: Greta Thunberg
quote: I often talk to people who say, 'No, we have to be hopeful and to inspire each other, and we can't tell [people] too many negative things'... But, no -- we have to tell it like it is. Because if there are no positive things to tell, then what should we do, should we spread false hope? We can't do that, we have to tell the truth.

author: Greta Thunberg
quote: Some people say that the climate crisis is something we have all created. But that is just another convenient lie. Because if everyone is guilty then no one is to blame.

author: Greta Thunberg
quote: You say nothing in life is black or white. But that is a lie. A very dangerous lie. Either we prevent 1.5 degree [Celsius] of warming or we don't. Either we avoid setting off that irreversible chain reaction beyond human control or we don't. Either we choose to go on as a civilisation or we don't. That is as black or white as it gets. There are no grey areas when it comes to survival.

author: Greta Thunberg
quote: We can't save the world by playing by the rules, because the rules have to be changed. Everything needs to change - and it has to start today.

author: Greta Thunberg
quote: We are in the beginning of a mass extinction. And all you can talk about is money and fairy tales of eternal economic growth.

author: Greta Thunberg
quote: You say that you love your children above everything else. And yet you are stealing their future.

author: Greta Thunberg
quote: Act as if you loved your children above all else.

author: Greta Thunberg
quote: We are exhausted, but we are also full of love and rage.

author: Greta Thunberg
quote: When haters go after your looks and differences, it means they have nowhere left to go. And then you know you're winning!

author: Greta Thunberg
quote: I have Asperger's syndrome and that means I'm sometimes a bit different from the norm. And--given the right circumstances--being different is a superpower.

author: Greta Thunberg
quote: Being different is a gift. If I would've been like everyone else, I wouldn't have started this school strike.

author: Ada Lovelace
quote: The science of operations, as derived from mathematics more especially, is a science of itself, and has its own abstract truth and value.

author: Ada Lovelace
quote: The intellectual, the moral, the religious seem to me all naturally bound up and interlinked together in one great and harmonious whole... That God is one, and that all the works and the feelings He has called into existence are ONE; this is a truth... not in my opinion developed to the apprehension of most people in its really deep and unfathomable meaning.

author: Ada Lovelace
quote: The Analytical Engine has no pretensions whatever to originate anything. It can do whatever we know how to order it to perform. It can follow analysis; but it has no power of anticipating any analytical relations or truths.

author: Ada Lovelace
quote: Imagination is the Discovering Faculty, pre-eminently... It is that which feels & discovers what is, the REAL which we see not, which exists not for our senses... Mathematical science shows what is. It is the language of unseen relations between things... Imagination too shows what is... Hence she is or should be especially cultivated by the truly Scientific, those who wish to enter into the worlds around us!

author: Ada Lovelace
quote: My unswerving principle is to strive to love the truth and God above fame and glory. Yours is to love the truth and God, but to love more fame, glory and honors.

author: Ada Lovelace
quote: Perhaps you have felt already, from the tone of my letter, that I am more than ever now the bride of science.

author: Ada Lovelace
quote: I can only end by repeating what I have often said before, that I am very troublesome, & only wish I could do you any such service as you are doing me.

author: Ada Lovelace
quote: We may say most aptly that the Analytical Engine weaves algebraic patterns just as the Jacquard loom weaves flowers and leaves.

author: Ada Lovelace
quote: What is imagination? It is a God-like, a noble faculty. It renders earth tolerable; it teaches us to live, in the tone of the eternal.

author: Ada Lovelace
quote: Those who view mathematical science, not merely as a vast body of abstract and immutable truths, whose intrinsic beauty, symmetry and logical completeness, when regarded in their connexion together as a whole, entitle them to a prominent place in the interest of all profound and logical minds...

author: Ada Lovelace
quote: If you can't give me poetry, can't you give me 'poetical science'?

author: Ada Lovelace
quote: I may remark that the curious transformations many formulae can undergo, the unsuspected and to a beginner apparently impossible identity of forms exceedingly dissimilar at first sight, is I think one of the chief difficulties in the early part of mathematical studies.
